en: Lindsay Zaltman: The first thing we saw was this idea  that you had two distinct, but complementary  sides to your brand personality --  the Morgan Spurlock brand is a mindful/play brand.
zh: 林赛·左特曼：这个想法的第一印象 你的品牌个性中有两个迥然不同 却相辅相成的两面－－ 摩根·斯普尔洛克品牌是一个既有思想又玩世不恭的品牌

en: And I think there's almost a paradox with those.
zh: 这两者几乎形成一个矛盾体

en: And you can see here too, Target, Wii,  Mini from the Mini Coopers, and JetBlue.
zh: 另外还有Target，Wii Mini Coopers中的Mini，还有JetBlue

en: Now there's playful brands and mindful brands,  those things that have come and gone,  but a playful, mindful brand is a pretty powerful thing.
zh: 有些品牌是“玩世不恭”的，有些品牌是有思想深度的 而这些品牌都不长久 但一个既有思想深度，又有些玩世不恭的品牌，是非常有力量的

en: MS: A playful, mindful brand. What is your brand?
zh: 斯普尔洛克：一个玩世不恭，又有思想的品牌。那么你的品牌呢？

en: Up attributes are things like being playful,  being fresh like the Fresh Prince,  contemporary, adventurous,  edgy or daring like Errol Flynn,  nimble or agile, profane, domineering,  magical or mystical like Gandalf.
zh: 高调品牌一般较为玩世不恭 就像Fresh Prince那样新奇 时尚，冒险 像埃罗尔·弗林那样前卫，大胆 敏捷，灵活，世俗，霸气 像甘道夫那样神奇又神秘

en: Are you mindful, sophisticated like 007?
zh: 你像007那样深思熟虑，世故老道？

en: But we did get 17 brand partners  who were willing to relinquish that control,  who wanted to be in business  with someone as mindful and as playful as myself  and who ultimately empowered us to tell stories  that normally we wouldn't be able to tell --  stories that an advertiser would normally never get behind.
zh: 但我们最终还是得到了17家合作公司 他们愿意交出控制权 他们愿意和像我这样 既有思想又玩世不恭的人合作 他们把讲述故事的权力完全交给了我们 讲述那些鲜为人知的故事－－ 那些广告商从未深入发掘的故事

en: They enabled us to tell the story about neuromarketing,  as we got into telling the story in this film  about how now they're using MRI's  to target the desire centers of your brain  for both commercials as well as movie marketing.
zh: 他们让我们讲述关于神经营销学的故事 我们在电影中 介绍他们如何先通过核磁共振成像技术 找到你大脑中控制欲求的区域 再来做广告，拍摄营销式电影

en: According to Burrelles, the movie premiered in January,  and since then -- and this isn't even the whole thing --  we've had 900 million media impressions for this film.
zh: 根据Burrelles 的数据，电影自一月份首度上映以来 -- 这还不是整部电影 -- 我们就得到了媒体对该电影的9亿次报道

en: It's not even online. It's not even streaming.

zh: 必须把那只熊关进笼子里

en: And that being said, through honesty and transparency,  my entire talk, "Embrace Transparency,"  has been brought to you  by my good friends at EMC,  who for $7,100  bought the naming rights on eBay.
zh: 我说过：通过诚信与透明 我的整个演讲“拥抱透明化” 由我在EMC的好友们 赞助播出 他们以7100美元 在Ebay网上买下了演讲冠名权

en: EMC: Turning big data  into big opportunity  for organizations all over the world.
zh: EMC： 变庞大数据 为巨大机遇 造福全球企业

en: EMC presents: "Embrace Transparency."
zh: EMC为您呈现“拥抱透明化”

en: June Cohen: So, Morgan,  in the name of transparency,  what exactly happened to that $7,100?
zh: 琼·柯翰：那么，摩根 为贯彻透明化的宗旨 那7100美元被弄到哪儿去啦？

en: MS: That is a fantastic question.
zh: 斯普尔洛克：这个问题问得太好了

en: I have in my pocket a check  made out to the parent organization to the TED organization,  the Sapling Foundation --  a check for $7,100  to be applied toward my attendance for next year's TED.
zh: 我口袋里有一张支票 是TED的母公司 种子基金会 开的一张7100美元支票 作为我明年TED的出场费

en: Their major asset for developing nuclear weapons  is the Natanz uranium enrichment facility.
zh: 他们用于开发核武器的主要设备 是纳坦兹的铀浓缩设施。

en: The gray boxes that you see,  these are real-time control systems.
zh: 各位看到的灰盒子 是实时控制系统。

en: The gray boxes don't run Windows software;  they are a completely different technology.
zh: 这个灰盒子不能运行Windows软件； 它们用的是完全不同的技术。

en: But if we manage  to place a good Windows virus  on a notebook  that is used by a maintenance engineer  to configure this gray box,  then we are in business.
zh: 但如果我们设法 把一个Windows病毒 放到一名 设备工程师用于配置 这个灰盒子的笔记本上， 然后我们就可以开始行动了。

en: So we start with a Windows dropper.
zh: 那么我从一个Windows注入器开始。

en: The payload goes onto the gray box,  damages the centrifuge,  and the Iranian nuclear program is delayed --  mission accomplished.
zh: 它携带的病毒传播到灰盒子， 破坏离心机， 伊朗核项目延迟 -- 任务完成。

en: The only thing that was known  is it's very, very complex on the Windows part, the dropper part,  used multiple zero-day vulnerabilities.
zh: 唯一知道的是， 它的Windows部分，注入器部分非常非常复杂， 使用了多重零日漏洞攻击。

en: And it seemed to want to do something  with these gray boxes, these real-time control systems.
zh: 它似乎想要对 这些灰盒子，这些实时控制系统做些什么。

en: Stuxnet behaved like a lab rat  that didn't like our cheese --  sniffed, but didn't want to eat.
zh: 震网病毒表现的像只 不喜欢起司的大白鼠 -- 嗅一嗅起司，但并不想吃。

en: The dropper is prowling actively  on the gray box if a specific configuration is found,  and even if the actual program code that it's trying to infect  is actually running on that target.
zh: 注入器就会 主动潜入灰盒子里， 即使它正试图感染的实际的程序 也在干着同样的事儿。

en: And if you have heard that the dropper of Stuxnet  is complex and high-tech,  let me tell you this:  the payload is rocket science.
zh: 如果各位曾经听说过，震网病毒的注入器 复杂且是高科技的， 让我告诉各位： 它携带的病毒非常复杂。

en: And then we were looking for timers and data structures  and trying to relate them to the real world --  to potential real world targets.
zh: 然后我们要找到定时器和数据结构， 接着尝试把它们和现实世界联系起来 -- 与潜在的现实世界目标联系起来。

en: It basically boils down  to the Bushehr nuclear power plant  and to the Natanz fuel enrichment plant.
zh: 基本上可以把目标缩小至 布歇赫尔核电厂 和纳坦兹的铀浓缩厂。

en: So we were able to associate  the small digital warhead  with the rotor control.
zh: 我们能把这个小的 数字弹头与转子控制器 联系起来了。

en: The big digital warhead -- we had a shot at this  at data and data structures.
zh: 大的数字弹头 -- 通过仔细地 观察数据和数据结构，

en: So for example, the number 164  really stands out in that code;  you can't overlook it.
zh: 我们有机会对它有所了解。 例如，数字164 在这些代码中非常引人注目； 不可能忽略它。

en: I started to research scientific literature  on how these centrifuges  are actually built in Natanz  and found they are structured  in what is called a cascade,  and each cascade holds 164 centrifuges.
zh: 我开始研究与这些分离机 如何被建造在纳坦兹 有关的科学文献， 并发现它们被组织在 一个被称为层级的东西之中， 每个层级包含164个离心机。

en: Anyway, so we figured out  that both digital warheads  were actually aiming at one and the same target,  but from different angles.
zh: 总之，我们找出了 这两个从不同角度 瞄准着同一个目标的 数字弹头。

en: The small warhead is taking one cascade,  and spinning up the rotors and slowing them down,  and the big warhead  is talking to six cascades  and manipulating valves.
zh: 小弹头选择一个层级， 旋转加速转子，接着让它们慢下来， 然后大弹头 选择六个层级 并操控阀门。

en: It is Natanz, and it is only Natanz.
zh: 就是纳坦兹，只可能是纳坦兹。

en: Down there is the gray box,  and on the top you see the centrifuges.
zh: 这儿下面是灰盒子， 在上面看到的是离心机。

en: Now what this thing does  is it intercepts the input values from sensors --  so for example, from pressure sensors  and vibration sensors --  and it provides legitimate program code,  which is still running during the attack,  with fake input data.
zh: 事情是这样的， 它拦截了从传感器发送来的输入值-- 例如，来自压力传感器 和震动传感器的输入值 -- 并提供合法的代码， 这代码会在攻击期间仍然保持运行， 随代码一起的还有假的输入数据。

en: So for example, in a power plant,  when your big steam turbine gets too over speed,  you must open relief valves within a millisecond.
zh: 例如，在发电厂， 当巨大的蒸汽轮机转速过快时， 必须在一毫秒内打开安全阀。

en: It doesn't have anything to do, in specifics,  with centrifuges,  with uranium enrichment.
zh: 它不需要对离心机， 对铀浓缩做什么 具体的事情。

en: Ralph, it's been quite widely reported  that people assume that Mossad  is the main entity behind this.
zh: 拉尔夫，广为流传 人们认为摩萨德 是幕后主使。

en: Ralph Langner: Okay, you really want to hear that?
zh: 拉尔夫·兰纳：好的，你真的想知道？

en: CA: Thank you for scaring the living daylights out of us. Thank you, Ralph.
zh: 克里斯：谢谢你吓了我们一大跳，谢谢你，拉尔夫。

en: So let me now introduce to you HULC --  or the Human Universal  Load Carrier.
zh: 那么现在让我向各位介绍一下HULC -- 全称是人类 负重外骨骼。

en: Soldier: With the HULC exoskeleton,  I can carry 200 lbs. over varied terrain  for many hours.
zh: 士兵：用了HULC外骨骼之后， 我能负重200磅。在复杂的地形中 行走多个小时。

en: Eythor Bender: We are ready with our industry partner  to introduce this device,  this new exoskeleton this year.
zh: 艾瑟·本德：我们与我们的行业伙伴以及准备好 引入这一设备， 在今年引入这一新的外骨骼。

en: There are 68 million people  estimated to be in wheelchairs worldwide.
zh: 世界上估计有 6千8百万轮椅使用者。

en: We are talking here about, oftentimes,  very young individuals with spinal cord injuries,  that in the prime of their life -- 20s, 30s, 40s --  hit a wall  and the wheelchair's the only option.
zh: 我们现在要说的是， 有脊髓损伤的非常年轻的人 在年富力强的时候 -- 20岁，30岁，40岁 -- 碰了壁 轮椅就成了唯一的选择。

en: Let me now introduce you to eLEGS  that is worn by Amanda Boxtel  that 19 years ago was spinal cord injured,  and as a result of that  she has not been able to walk  for 19 years until now.
zh: 现在让我向各位介绍eLEGS， 穿着者是阿曼达·波斯特， 她19年前受到了脊柱损伤， 由此导致 她19年来无法行走， 直到现在。

en: Amanda Boxtel: Thank you.
zh: 阿曼达·波斯特：谢谢。

en: EB: Amanda is wearing our eLEGS set.
zh: 艾瑟：我说了，阿曼达穿着的就是我们的eLEGS。

en: It's completely non-invasive,  sensors in the crutches  that send signals back to our onboard computer  that is sitting here at her back.
zh: 在这些支撑内完全是非侵入的 传感器， 它们发送信号至装在 她背部的机载电脑。

en: There are battery packs here as well  that power motors that are sitting at her hips,  as well as her knee joints,  that move her forward  in this kind of smooth and very natural gait.
zh: 同时还有个电池组， 为装在她臀部的电动机提供能量， 包括她膝关节处的电动机， 这让她能 以平稳自然的步伐前进。

en: AB: I was 24 years old  and at the top of my game  when a freak summersault while downhill skiing  paralyzed me.
zh: 阿曼达：我24岁时 在生命的最巅峰， 我速降滑雪时不慎摔倒， 我瘫痪了。

en: He robbed  every ounce of hope  Adaptive technology  has since enabled me  to learn how to downhill ski again,  to rock climb and even handcycle.
zh: 他剥夺了 我存在的 每一丝希望。 自适应技术 曾使我能够 再次学习如何速降滑雪， 攀岩，甚至手动自行车。

en: EB: As you can see,  we have the technology,  we have the platforms  to sit down and have discussions with you.
zh: 艾瑟：正如各位所看到的， 我们有了技术， 我们有了能坐下 的平台，这已经和大家讨论过了。

en: It's a place where women run the show,  have sex to say hello,  and play rules the day --  where fun is serious business.
zh: 在这个社群，女性主导一切， 要做爱就打声招呼， 玩乐是全天的法宝-- 快乐玩耍是个正经严肃的事。

en: And no, this isn't Burning Man  or San Francisco.
zh: 不是的，这不是指欲火焚烧的男人 也不是指旧金山。

en: This is the world of wild bonobos  in the jungles of Congo.
zh: 这就是野生倭黑猩猩的世界 座落于刚果的丛林中。

en: While chimpanzees  are dominated by big, scary guys,  bonobo society  is run by empowered females.
zh: 当黑猩猩 被又大又吓人的雄黑猩猩统领时， 倭黑猩猩社群 是由雌倭黑猩猩所领导。

en: But unfortunately,  bonobos are the least understood  of the great apes.
zh: 但不幸的是， 倭黑猩猩是类人猿里最难被了解的 一种。

en: The Congo is a paradox --  a land of extraordinary biodiversity and beauty,  but also the heart of darkness itself --  the scene of a violent conflict  that has raged for decades  and claimed nearly as many lives  as the First World War.
zh: 刚果是个似是而非的矛盾体-- 她是一块孕育非凡的生物多样性和美丽的土地， 但她自身也是黑暗之心-- 暴力冲突的场景 已经持续了几十年 这夺走了许多生命 就如第一次世界大战一样。

en: Bushmeat trades and forest loss  means we couldn't fill a small stadium  with all the bonobos that are left in the world --  and we're not even sure of that to be honest.
zh: 猎寻兽肉的买卖和丛林消失 意味着我们不能 给在世界上仅存的倭黑猩猩们提供一个小小的栖息地-- 实话，我们甚至都不能确定是否会有一个小的栖息地。

en: Now, I'm not saying this is the solution  to all of humanity's problems --  since there's more to bonobo life  than the Kama Sutra.
zh: 我现在不是说这就是解决 人类所有问题的方法-- 因为玩乐对于倭黑猩猩来说 比起欲经意味更多。

en: For us and them,  play is foundational for bonding relationships  and fostering tolerance.
zh: 对于我们人类和倭黑猩猩， 玩乐是建立亲密关系 和培养容忍性的基础。

en: And when you watch bonobo play,  you're seeing the very evolutionary roots  of human laughter, dance  and ritual.
zh: 当你看倭黑猩猩玩乐时， 你会看到非常进化的根源 有关人类的笑声，跳舞 和仪式。

en: Play is the glue  that binds us together.
zh: 玩乐就是粘结剂 使得我们相互联系在一起。

en: First, it's a ball game bonobo-style --  and I do not mean football.
zh: 首先，这是一个倭黑猩猩式的球类游戏-- 我不是指足球。

en: It might be the evolutionary origin of the phrase,  "she's got him by the balls."
zh: 这可能就是短语 “她在玩弄他的蛋蛋。”的进化起源。

en: And this video is really interesting  because it shows --  this video's really interesting  because it shows the inventiveness  of bringing unusual elements into play --  such as testicles --  and also how play both requires trust  and fosters trust --  while at the same time being tremendous fun.
zh: 这个视频真的很有趣 因为它证明-- 这个视频真的很有趣 因为它证明了 把不寻常的因素带进游戏里所产生的创造性-- 例如睾丸-- 游戏如何能寻求信任 和培养信任-- 与此同时又乐趣无穷。

en: Play's a shapeshifter,  and it can take many forms,  some of which are more quiet,  imaginative, curious --  maybe where wonder is discovered anew.
zh: 玩乐是一个变形的过程， 它可以变成许多玩乐游戏， 一些游戏是较安静的， 富有想象力的，探于求索的-- 或许这玩乐的奇妙是发现新鲜事。

en: And I want you to see,  this is Fuku, a young female,  and she is quietly playing with water.
zh: 我想让大家看看， 这是福酷，一个年轻雌倭黑猩猩， 她正在悄然地玩耍水。

en: And so, my fellow primates,  let us embrace this gift from evolution  and play together,  as we rediscover creativity,  fellowship and wonder.
zh: 那么，我的灵长类的同胞们， 让我们拥护这天赋进化的礼物 让我们一起嬉戏玩乐， 由此我们重新发现创造力， 情同手足的关系和奇迹。

en: When I'm not fighting poverty, I'm fighting fires  as the assistant captain of a volunteer fire company.
zh: 在我消灭贫穷之余，我也灭火 我是志愿消防居的副指挥

en: Now in our town,  where the volunteers supplement a highly skilled career staff,  you have to get to the fire scene pretty early  to get in on any action.
zh: 在我们的小镇 在一个志愿者都是成功人士的地方 你必须要很早到现场 才有可能加入战况

en: I was the second volunteer on the scene,  so there was a pretty good chance I was going to get in.
zh: 我是第二个到现场的志愿者 很有可能可以进火场

en: But still it was a real footrace against the other volunteers  to get to the captain in charge  to find out what our assignments would be.
zh: 但你还得跑赢其它志愿者 先找到总指挥 让他分配工作给你

en: When I found the captain,  he was having a very engaging conversation  with the homeowner,  who was surely having one of the worst days of her life.
zh: 当我好不容易找到总指挥 他正全神贯注地 和屋主讨论 她显然正经历人生中最糟糕的一天

en: Here it was, the middle of the night,  she was standing outside in the pouring rain,  under an umbrella, in her pajamas, barefoot,  while her house was in flames.
zh: 当时是大半夜 她站在滂沱大雨中 穿着睡衣、打赤脚、撑着伞 她的房子正在熊熊燃烧

en: The other volunteer who had arrived just before me --  let's call him Lex Luther --    got to the captain first  and was asked to go inside  and save the homeowner's dog.
zh: 另外一个比我先来一步的志愿者 就叫他Lex Luther 好了  先到了总指挥身边 他被分配到 杀进火场去拯救屋主的小狗

en: The dog! I was stunned with jealousy.
zh: 小狗哎！我嫉妒死了

en: He said, "Bezos, I need you to go into the house.
zh: 他说，“Bezos，我需要你杀进火场

en: I need you to go upstairs, past the fire,  and I need you to get this woman a pair of shoes."
zh: 我需要你上楼，越过火焰 我需要你为这位女士拿双鞋。 “

en: A few weeks later,  the department received a letter from the homeowner  thanking us for the valiant effort displayed  in saving her home.
zh: 几个礼拜后 我们部门收到从屋主来的一封信 谢谢我们的拯救她家的 义勇行为

en: So as I look around this room  at people who either have achieved,  or are on their way to achieving,  remarkable levels of success,  I would offer this reminder:  don't wait.
zh: 当我环顾四周 这些成功的 或正要成功的人士 你们都有着令人激赏的成就 我想在这里提醒你们： 不要等待

en: This may sound strange,  but I'm a big fan of the concrete block.
zh: 听起来可能有点怪， 我是个水泥砖的狂热爱好者。

en: They enabled us to to build things that were larger than us,  buildings, bridges,  one brick at a time.
zh: 它使得我们能制造远大于自身的东西， 建筑，桥梁， 就这样一砖一瓦砌成。

en: Like the concrete block,  the transistor allows you to build  much larger, more complex circuits, one brick at a time.
zh: 像水泥砖一样， 你可以运用它 一个晶体管一个晶体管地制造出更大的、更复杂的电路。

en: But there's a main difference:  The transistor was only for experts.
zh: 但是有一个主要的区别： 只有专家才能玩转晶体管。

en: A few years ago I started developing littleBits.
zh: 几年前我开始开发littleBits。

en: LittleBits are electronic modules  with each one specific function.
zh: LittleBits是电子的模块 每一块都有特定的功能。

en: And the best part about it  is they snap together with magnets.
zh: 最棒的就是 它们是用磁力吸合在一起的

en: Green is output, blue is power,  pink is input and orange is wire.
zh: 绿色是输出，蓝色是电源， 粉色是输入，橙色是连接线。

en: You can put a knob in between  and now you've made a little dimmer.
zh: 你可以在中间放一个旋钮 你就做成了一个小调光器。

en: Add this buzzer  for some extra punch  and you've created a noise machine.
zh: 加入这个蜂鸣器 来增加点效果 你就创造出了一台噪音机。

en: I'm going to stop that.
zh: 我得收手了。

en: So beyond simple play,  littleBits are actually pretty powerful.
zh: 除了简单地玩， 实际上littleBits 的功能很强劲。

en: Instead of having to program, to wire, to solder,  littleBits allow you to program  using very simple intuitive gestures.
zh: 不需要编程、接线、焊接， littleBits可以让你 用简单的直觉动作完成编程。

en: The idea behind littleBits  is that it's a growing library.
zh: 隐藏在littleBits之后的想法是 这是一个可成长的资料库。

en: We've been giving littleBits to kids and seeing them play with them.
zh: 我们曾经把littleBits给孩子们并看他们玩。

en: We've also been taking littleBits to design schools.
zh: 我们也曾经把littleBits带到设计学校。

en: So for example, we've had designers  with no experience with electronics whatsoever  start to play with littleBits as a material.
zh: 比如说，我们曾经让设计师 完全没有电子相关经验的设计师 用littleBits做素材开始玩。

en: Here you see, with felt and paper water bottles,  we have Geordie making ...
zh: 大家可以看到，用毡和纸瓶子 乔迪做出了...

en: A few weeks ago we took littleBits to RISD  and gave them to some designers  with no experience in engineering whatsoever --  just cardboard, wood and paper -- and told them "Make something."
zh: 几星期前我们带着littleBits去了罗德岛设计学院 把它交给一些 完全没有工程经验的设计师 只给一些纸板、木头和纸 -- 跟他们说 “做点什么”

en: Here's an example of a project they made,  a motion-activated confetti canon ball.
zh: 这就是他们完成的一个项目 一个动作触发的彩纸屑炮弹

en: To these non-engineers, littleBits became another material,  electronics became just another material.
zh: 对这些非工程技术人员，littleBits成为了另一种材料， 电子也只是一种材料。

en: So littleBits is open-source.
zh: 所以littleBits是开源的。

en: The program is called Code for America,  and it's a little bit like a Peace Corps for geeks.
zh: 这个项目叫做 “美国代码”， 有点像怪杰的和平队。

en: Al is a fire hydrant in the city of Boston.
zh: Al是一个伯斯顿市内的消防栓。

en: Here it kind of looks like he's looking for a date,  but what he's really looking for is for someone to shovel him out when he gets snowed in,  because he knows he's not very good at fighting fires  when he's covered in four feet of snow.
zh: 这里看起来它似乎是在等它的约会， 但它真正等待的是一个可以将它被深埋在雪下的时候可以将它挖出来的人， 因为它知道当它被四英尺的雪埋入时， 它救火的能力就会下降。

en: We had a team of fellows in Boston last year  through the Code for America program.
zh: 去年我们“美国代码” 有个在伯斯顿工作的团队。

en: They were there in February, and it snowed a lot in February last year.
zh: 他们在的时候正值二月，而去年二月雪下得很多很大。

en: But one fellow in particular,  a guy named Erik Michaels-Ober,  noticed something else,  and that's that citizens are shoveling out sidewalks  right in front of these things.
zh: 那个团队的其中一个人， 叫Erik Michaels-Ober， 留意到了另外一个现象： 市民们会将这些消防栓 前面的走道上的雪铲除。

en: There's a guy in the I.T. department of the City of Honolulu  who saw this app and realized  that he could use it, not for snow,  but to get citizens to adopt tsunami sirens.
zh: 一个在夏威夷檀香山市的IT部门上班的人 看到了这个程序，然后意识到 它不一定要用它来铲雪， 也可以用它让市民领养海啸警报器。

en: And then Seattle decided to use it  to get citizens to clear out clogged storm drains.
zh: 然后西雅图决定用它 让市民清理暴雨后杜塞的下水道口。

en: We had a team that worked on a project in Boston last year  that took three people about two and a half months.
zh: 去年我们在伯斯顿有一个 三个人的团队花了两个半月完成了一个项目。

en: And that's that when you strip away all your feelings  about politics and the line at the DMV  and all those other things  that we're really mad about,  government is, at its core,  in the words of Tim O'Reilly,  "What we do together that we can't do alone."
zh: 那就是，当你剥开一切 让我们愤怒的外壳， 比如我们对政治的感觉， 和在车辆管理局外的长队， 政府，在其中心， 用提姆·奥莱理的话说， “政府能帮我们达成我们一个人无法达成的事情。”

en: If you should ever have the chance  to staff your city's call center,  as our fellow Scott Silverman did as part of the program --  in fact, they all do that --  you will find that people call government  with a very wide range of issues,  including having an opossum stuck in your house.
zh: 如果你会有机会 在你的市热线中心工作， 像我们项目的同事Scott Silverman就做这个 - 事实上，他们都需要做这项服务 - 你就会发现人们为了非常不同的问题 打电话给政府咨询， 包括家中困入了一个负鼠。

en: And finally, he says, "Look, can you just open all the doors to your house  and play music really loud  and see if the thing leaves?"
zh: 而最后，他说：“这样吧，你可以将你家的门全部打开， 然后放起很大声的音乐， 然后看看这东西会不会离开？”

en: Boston doesn't just have a call center.
zh: 波斯顿没有热线中心。

en: This is the work of the very smart people  at the Office of New Urban Mechanics in Boston.
zh: 它是一群在波斯顿的 新城市结构部门的很聪明的人编写的。

en: So Scott was speaking person-to-person.
zh: Scott之前是人对人的交流。

en: It's a group of concerned citizens  that have written a very detailed  325-page report  that's a response to the SEC's request for comment  on the Financial Reform Bill.
zh: 他们是一群忧心忡忡的公民 他们写了一份非常详细的， 325页的报告 来回应美国证券交易委员会SEC 对于金融改革法案的要求。

en: Now the average age of our fellows is 28,  so I am, begrudgingly,  almost a generation older than most of them.
zh: 我们的工作人员的平均年龄是28岁， 所以我，很不甘的， 几乎比他们大部分老了一代。

en: That could be shoveling out a hydrant, pulling a weed,  turning over a garbage can with an opossum in it.
zh: 它可以是将消防栓从雪中挖出，将杂草拔除， 或将有负鼠的垃圾桶放倒。

en: And certainly, we could have been shoveling out those fire hydrants all along,  and many people do.
zh: 当然，很多人早就开始将消防栓 从雪中挖出了。

en: So the question I have for all of you here:  When it comes to the big, important things  that we need to do together,  all of us together,  are we just going to be a crowd of voices,  or are we also going to be  a crowd of hands?
zh: 所以在这里我留给大家一个问题： 当我们面对一些很大的，很重要的， 并需要我们齐心协力一起做 事情的时候， 我们会只是有话语权的一群人， 还是我们 也会是众手协力而成事的一群人？

en: I spend most of my time  in jails, in prisons, on death row.
zh: 我大多数时候都 在管教所，在监狱里，在死囚室中

en: And being here at TED  and seeing the stimulation, hearing it,  has been very, very energizing to me.
zh: 今天来到TED 看到听到这些激动人心的演讲 给了我一针强心剂

en: Her parents were born in slavery in Virginia in the 1840's.
zh: 弗吉尼亚州19世纪40年代，她父母落草为奴

en: And I remember, when I was about eight or nine years old,  waking up one morning, going into the living room,  and all of my cousins were running around.
zh: 我记得，当我八九岁时的一次 我早上醒来，跑到客厅 所有的表兄妹都在

en: And after about 15 or 20 minutes of this,  she got up and she came across the room  and she took me by the hand  and she said, "Come on, Bryan. You and I are going to have a talk."
zh: 大概十五还是二十分钟之后 她站起来，穿过房间 牵住我的手 对我说：“过来，布莱恩，我们得谈谈。”

en: Then she said, "The second thing I want you to promise me  is that you'll always do the right thing  even when the right thing is the hard thing."
zh: 接着她说：“第二件事，是你要答应我 你会永远走正路 即使走正路是很难的选择。”

en: I grew up in the country in the rural South,  and I have a brother a year older than me and a sister a year younger.
zh: 我在南部的乡下长大 我有个哥哥大我一岁，还有个妹妹小我一岁

en: When I was about 14 or 15,  one day my brother came home and he had this six-pack of beer --  I don't know where he got it --  and he grabbed me and my sister and we went out in the woods.
zh: 当我十四五岁时 一天我哥哥带回到家半打啤酒—— 我都不知道他怎么弄到的—— 他带上我和我妹妹，跑到树林里

en: And we were kind of just out there doing the stuff we crazily did.
zh: 一通疯玩疯跑

en: My brother said, "Come on. We're doing this today; you always do what we do.
zh: 我哥哥说：“来嘛，我们今个儿都喝。你老是和我们一条阵线的。

en: But I'm 52 years old,  and I'm going to admit to you  that I've never had a drop of alcohol.
zh: 我今年五十二了 我要向大家承认 我从来没有喝过一滴酒

en: I don't say that because I think that's virtuous;  I say that because there is power in identity.
zh: 这不是为了显派我多有道德 是为了说明自我定位的威力

en: My grandfather was in prison during prohibition.
zh: 我的外公因为违了禁在蹲监狱

en: The United States now has the highest rate of incarceration  We have seven million people on probation and parole.
zh: 今天美国是世界上 服刑人口比例最高的国家 我们有七百万人在缓刑期和假释期

en: One out of three black men  between the ages of 18 and 30  is in jail, in prison, on probation or parole.
zh: 三分之一的黑人男性 十八岁到三十岁之间的 不是在监狱里，就是在缓刑期或者假释期

en: In urban communities across this country --  Los Angeles, Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington --  50 to 60 percent of all young men of color are  in jail or prison or on probation or parole.
zh: 在全国各处的城市社区里—— 洛杉矶，费城，巴尔的摩，华盛顿—— 百分之五十到六十的有色人种的年轻人 不是在监狱里，就是在缓刑期或者假释期

en: Right now in Alabama  34 percent of the black male population  has permanently lost the right to vote.
zh: 现在在阿拉巴马州 百分之三十四的黑人男性 永远失去了投票权

en: I represent children.
zh: 我代表孩子们上庭

en: The United States is the only country in the world  where we sentence 13-year-old children  to die in prison.
zh: 美国是世界上唯一能将 十三岁的孩子 判成终身监禁的国家

en: In many ways, we've been taught to think  that the real question is,  do people deserve to die for the crimes they've committed?
zh: 我们从各种渠道了解到 根本问题是 人该不该为他们犯的罪行偿命

en: The other way of thinking about it  is not, do people deserve to die for the crimes they commit,  but do we deserve to kill?
zh: 另一个想问题的方式 不是人们该不该为罪行偿命 而是我们配不配杀他们

en: In aviation, we would never let people fly on airplanes  if for every nine planes that took off  one would crash.
zh: 学航空的人知道，如果每九架飞机里 会有一架出事故 我们肯定是不会让这玩意儿载人飞的

en: And it's interesting, when I teach my students about African-American history,  I tell them about slavery.
zh: 这很发人深省。当我教美国黑人历史的时候 我和学生讲奴隶制

en: I tell them about terrorism,  the era that began at the end of reconstruction  that went on to World War II.
zh: 和他们讲恐怖主义 那个始于大复兴晚期 一直到二战时期的时代

en: And these older people come up to me now  and they say, "Mr. Stevenson, you give talks, you make speeches,  you tell people to stop saying  we're dealing with terrorism for the first time in our nation's history  after 9/11."
zh: 那时的人现在上了年纪，来和我说 “史蒂文森先生，你到处演讲 你得告诉大家 别说什么911以后是我们美国有史以来 第一次对付恐怖主义。”

en: It was fascinating  because one of the scholars stood up after the presentation  and said, "Well you know it's deeply troubling  to hear what you're talking about."
zh: 结果很绝妙 因为在讲谈后有个学者站起来 说：“你要知道， 听你谈这个很痛心。”

en: It would be unconscionable for us  to, in an intentional and deliberate way,  set about executing people."
zh: 公开化且下意识地 执行死刑，对我们来说 是良心上无法接受的

en: You know ultimately, we all have to believe things we haven't seen.
zh: 要知道最终，我们得相信那些没亲眼见的事

en: And it's that mind-heart connection  that I believe compels us  to not just be attentive  to all the bright and dazzly things,  but also the dark and difficult things.
zh: 这个灵智合一 我相信会驱使我们 不仅仅是对那些 光明的事情更上心 同时对那些黑暗面和棘手的事情也是一样

en: Vaclav Havel, the great Czech leader, talked about this.
zh: 韦克拉乌·哈韦尔，这位捷克的杰出领导人，谈过这个问题

en: He said, "When we were in Eastern Europe and dealing with oppression,  we wanted all kinds of things,  but mostly what we needed was hope,  an orientation of the spirit,  a willingness to sometimes be in hopeless places  and be a witness."
zh: 他说：“当我们在东欧解决强制压迫的问题时 我们希望能成就很多 但是最重要的，我们要一个希望 一个心灵的指向 一种不惮于体会绝望的态度 以及为史留证的意愿。”

en: I had the great privilege, when I was a young lawyer, of meeting Rosa Parks.
zh: 当我是个年轻律师，我有幸见到帕克斯夫人

en: And Ms. Parks used to come back to Montgomery every now and then,  and she would get together with two of her dearest friends,  these older women,  Johnnie Carr who was the organizer  of the Montgomery bus boycott --  amazing African-American woman --  and Virginia Durr, a white woman,  whose husband, Clifford Durr, represented Dr. King.
zh: 帕克斯夫人曾时不时会到蒙哥马利 每次她都会和两个好友会面 两位上了年纪的女性 姜妮·卡尔，她是蒙哥马利 公车抵制运动的组织者—— 非常出色的黑人女性—— 还有弗吉尼亚·杜尔，一位白人女性 她丈夫克利福德·杜尔是马丁·路德·金的律师

en: And every now and then Ms. Carr would call me,  and she'd say, "Bryan, Ms. Parks is coming to town. We're going to get together and talk.
zh: 有时卡尔夫人会给我打电话 问我：“帕克斯夫人回来了，我们要聚聚。

en: And one time I was over there listening to these women talk,  and after a couple of hours Ms. Parks turned to me  and she said, "Now Bryan, tell me what the Equal Justice Initiative is.
zh: 有一次我在那里听她们谈话 几小时后帕克斯夫人问我 她问：“布莱恩，和我讲讲你的平等司法倡议。

en: We're trying to help people who have been wrongly convicted.
zh: 我们想帮那些被误判了刑的人。

en: And that's when Ms. Carr leaned forward, she put her finger in my face,  she said, "That's why you've got to be brave, brave, brave."
zh: 这时卡尔夫人凑过来，她把手放在我脸边说： “这就是为什么你要很勇敢很勇敢很勇敢。”

en: I think if somebody takes something that doesn't belong to them,  they're not just a thief.
zh: 如果他拿了不属于他的东西 并不说明他就是个惯偷

en: Because it's in that nexus  that we actually begin to understand truly profound things  about who we are.
zh: 因为正是在这个合流点 我们真正地开始对于我们是什么样的人 有了深入的理解

en: And I go to the jail and I see my client who's 13 and 14,  and he's been certified to stand trial as an adult.
zh: 我去管教所，看见我的被告都是十三四岁 他们被说成是成年人，作为成年人对待

en: And I started working on this motion,  and the head of the motion was: "Motion to try my poor,  14-year-old black male client  like a privileged, white 75-year-old  corporate executive."
zh: 我开始做他的辩护 标题是：“提案：将我的 十四岁的穷黑孩子 想成一个七十五岁的特级 白人企业高管。”

en: And I put in my motion  that there was prosecutorial misconduct and police misconduct and judicial misconduct.
zh: 在这个提案里 我说检察院，警察局和法庭都处理不当

en: There was a crazy line in there about how there's no conduct in this county,  it's all misconduct.
zh: 说这个法院没有合情合法这一说之类的疯话 全是故意乱判

en: And I finally decided,  oh gosh, I've got to go to the court and do this crazy case.
zh: 最后我决定 天哪，我得上庭去做这个案子

en: And I was thinking, this is going to be so difficult, so painful.
zh: 我在想，这将会是场硬仗，会很痛苦

en: And as I was walking up the steps of this courthouse,  there was an older black man who was the janitor in this courthouse.
zh: 当我上台阶时 有个上了年纪的黑人老伯，法院的清洁工

en: And this man came over to me  and he hugged me.
zh: 这个老伯凑过来 给了我一个拥抱

en: And I have to tell you,  it was energizing.
zh: 我得和大家承认 这可给了我一针强心剂

en: He said, "Mr. Stevenson, did you write this crazy motion?"
zh: “史蒂文森先生，是你写了这个疯案么？”

en: I had written these crazy things.
zh: 我的确写了不少挺够劲的事情

en: And before I knew it, the courtroom was filled with people  angry that we were talking about race,  that we were talking about poverty,  that we were talking about inequality.
zh: 我还没回过神来，整个法庭站满了人 全很愤怒，因为我们在谈种族问题 我们在谈贫穷 我们在谈不平等待遇

en: And out of the corner of my eye, I could see this janitor pacing back and forth.
zh: 我眼角瞟到那个清洁工，在外面走来走去

en: He kept pacing back and forth.
zh: 他就这样来回来去地走

en: And finally, this older black man with this very worried look on his face  came into the courtroom and sat down behind me,  almost at counsel table.
zh: 最后，这个黑人老伯进来了 一脸担心地坐在我后面 几乎顶到了辩护台

en: And during the break there was a deputy sheriff who was offended  that the janitor had come into court.
zh: 休息期间，一个副警长觉得清洁工进法庭 有失面子

en: And this deputy jumped up and he ran over to this older black man.
zh: 这个副警长跳起来，向这个老伯冲过去

en: And this older black man stood up  and he looked at that deputy and he looked at me  and he said, "I came into this courtroom  to tell this young man,  keep your eyes on the prize, hold on."
zh: 这个老黑人站起来 看看这个副警长，看看我 他说：“我进来 是想告诉这个年轻人 往前看，往好了看，挺住。”

en: 56 percent of all rape cases don't result.
zh: 百分之五十六的强奸案，查不出来

en: And so we have three strikes laws  that put people in prison forever  for stealing a bicycle, for low-level property crimes,  rather than making them give those resources back  to the people who they victimized.
zh: 同时我们有三击出局的规定 能把一些人永久监禁起来 只是因为偷了辆自行车，或者一点点财物 我们并不给他们机会对受害人 作出补偿

en: Announcer Two: Famine in Somalia. Announcer Three: Police pepper spray.
zh: 播音员2：索马里出现饥荒。播音员3：警察使用胡椒喷雾。

en: Announcer Six: Societal decay. Announcer Seven: 65 dead.
zh: 播音员6：社会风气败坏。播音员7：65人死亡。

en: Recession. Default. Doomsday. Egypt. Syria.
zh: 经济衰退、违约、末日、埃及、叙利亚、

en: Peter Diamandis: So those are just a few of the clips  I collected over the last six months --  could have easily been the last six days  or the last six years.
zh: 彼得迪曼蒂斯：这是我在过去6个月里 收集的一些视频。 如果是在6天，或者过去6年里 也可以轻易收集到类似的片段。

en: And because nothing is more important to us  than survival,  the first stop of all of that data  is an ancient sliver of the temporal lobe  called the amygdala.
zh: 而其中没有比与生存相关的信息 更重要的。 所有信息输入的第一站就是 颞叶上一个叫做大脑扁桃体的 非常原始的部分。

en: Now the amygdala is our early warning detector,  our danger detector.
zh: 大脑扁桃体是我们的早期预警侦测器， 危险探测仪。

en: And that old newspaper saying,  "If it bleeds it leads,"  is very true.
zh: 那个过去有关报纸的说法： ”流血事件必上头条。“ 其实是很有道理的。

en: Steve Pinker has showed us  that, in fact, we're living during the most peaceful time ever  in human history.
zh: 史蒂夫平克为我们指出, 我们正生活在人类历史上 最和平的时代。

en: And Charles Kenny  that global literacy has gone from 25 percent to over 80 percent  in the last 130 years.
zh: 还有查尔斯·肯尼提到 世界范围的识字率在过去的130年里从25％ 上升到了80％。

en: The wealthiest robber barons of the last century, the emperors on this planet,  could have never dreamed of such luxuries.
zh: 上世纪最富有的强盗大亨，这个星球上的帝王们， 永远都想象不到这样的奢侈生活。

en: My good friend Ray Kurzweil  showed that any tool that becomes an information technology  jumps on this curve, on Moore's Law,  and experiences price performance doubling  every 12 to 24 months.
zh: 我的好朋友雷·库兹威尔 展示了任何信息科技的工具 都遵从这条曲线，即摩尔定律。 并经历每12到24个月 性价比翻一倍的增长。

en: And also, even though it's plotted  on a log curve on the left,  it's curving upwards.
zh: 尽管在左边 呈现出对数曲线 它也是仍然是向上弯曲。

en: The rate at which the technology is getting faster  is itself getting faster.
zh: 科技前进加速的本身 也在不断变快。

en: I mean, how many of you saw the winning of Jeopardy  by IBM's Watson?
zh: 观众中多少人看到了IBM的Watson超级电脑在 Jeopardy智力竞赛的获胜？

en: Jeopardy's not an easy game.
zh: Jeopardy不是个容易的比赛。

en: Four years ago here at TED,  Ray Kurzweil and I started a new university  called Singularity University.
zh: 四年前在TED, 雷·库兹威尔和我创立了一所新的大学 叫做“Singularity University”。

en: So this is a story of Napoleon III  in the mid-1800s.
zh: 这是一个拿破仑三世的故事 在1800到1810年中期。

en: He invited over to dinner  the king of Siam.
zh: 邀请了泰王 共进晚餐。

en: All of Napoleon's troops  were fed with silver utensils,  Napoleon himself with gold utensils.
zh: 所有拿破仑的士兵 使用银器用餐， 拿破仑自己则使用金器。

en: You see, even though aluminum  is 8.3 percent of the Earth by mass,  it doesn't come as a pure metal.
zh: 即使铝占了地球 总重量的8.3%。 但它不是以纯金属的形态存在。

en: It's all bound by oxygen and silicates.
zh: 它都是和氧或者硅酸结合。

en: But then the technology of electrolysis came along  and literally made aluminum so cheap  that we use it with throw-away mentality.
zh: 但是随后出现了电解技术 使得铝的价格如此低廉 以致我们就把铝制品当一次性用品般看待。

en: It's not about being scarce,  it's about accessibility.
zh: 问题并不是能源稀缺， 而是可及性。

en: For the first time, this year  the cost of solar-generated electricity  is 50 percent that of diesel-generated electricity in India --  8.8 rupees versus 17 rupees.
zh: 今年是有史以来第一次 在印度，太阳能发电的成本降低至 化石燃料发电成本的一半-- 8.8卢布相比较17卢布。

en: Last month, MIT put out a study  showing that by the end of this decade,  in the sunny parts of the United States,  solar electricity will be six cents a kilowatt hour  compared to 15 cents  as a national average.
zh: 上个月，MIT发布了一个研究报告 显示到2020年 在美国阳光充足的地区， 太阳能电力费用会降至6美分一千瓦／小时 相比较全国平均 标准是15美分。

en: And if we have abundant energy,  we also have abundant water.
zh: 如果我们有充足的能源， 也就会有丰富的洁净水。

en: Do you remember  when Carl Sagan turned the Voyager spacecraft  back towards the Earth,  in 1990 after it just passed Saturn?
zh: 还记得吗？ 1990年，Carl Saga在航海者太空飞船 经过土星的时候， 调转其方向面对地球。

en: We live on a planet 70 percent covered by water.
zh: 地球表面70％被水覆盖

en: And the conversation I had with Dean Kamen this morning,  one of the great DIY innovators,  I'd like to share with you -- he gave me permission to do so --  his technology called Slingshot  that many of you may have heard of,  it is the size of a small dorm room refrigerator.
zh: 今天早上我和一个伟大的DIY 发明家Dean Kamen聊天。 我想要和大家分享－我得到了他的允许－ 他开发的技术叫做“弹弓” 在座的一些朋友可能听说过， 它是一个小房间一般大的冰箱，

en: a thousand liters of clean drinking water a day  out of any source -- saltwater, polluted water, latrine --  at less than two cents a liter.
zh: 每天可以从 任何水源中－海水，污染水，公共厕所－ 生产出一千公升的洁净饮用水。 每公升的成本低于2美分。

en: My goodness, we're going to hit 70 percent penetration  of cellphones in the developing world  by the end of 2013.
zh: 我的天哪，在2013年底，发展中国家的 移动电话渗透率将 达到70％。

en: Last month, I had the pleasure of announcing with Qualcomm Foundation  something called the $10 million Qualcomm Tricorder X Prize.
zh: 上个月我很荣幸和高通基金共同宣布 1000万美金高通手持移动分析仪X大赛。

en: We're challenging teams around the world  to basically combine these technologies  into a mobile device  that you can speak to, because it's got A.I.,  you can cough on it, you can do a finger blood prick.
zh: 我们向全世界的团队发出挑战 来将这些科技 组合进移动设备。 你可以向它说话，因为它拥有人工智能 也可以对着它咳嗽，或者扎手指验血。

en: These people represent  tens of trillions of dollars  injected into the global economy.
zh: 这些人代表着 几十万亿美元的消费力 将会注入全球经济体。

en: And it showed that, in fact, today,  the human pattern recognition machinery  is better at folding proteins than the best computers.
zh: 它也展示出时至今日， 人类的模式辨识机能 仍然要比最好的电脑都要强。

en: And you'd think he was chasing finches,  but he wasn't.
zh: 你们可能以为他在追鸟雀 其实不是

en: The second story, also to illustrate another concept,  is called shifting waistline.
zh: 第二个故事 讲的是另一个概念 叫做变动的"腰准线"

en: Because I was there in '71,  studying a lagoon in West Africa.
zh: （众人笑） 1971年的时候 我在那里 考察西非的一片西湖

en: And it had tilapia  about 20 centimeters,  a species of tilapia called blackchin tilapia.
zh: 这里有罗非鱼 大概20厘米长 这种罗非鱼叫黑颚罗非鱼

en: They were maturing at five centimeters.
zh: 它们成年时只有五厘米长

en: And this boat, quite ugly,  is called the Mutiara 4.
zh: 这艘船 挺难看的 叫Mutiara 4号

en: And I went sailing on it,  and we did surveys  throughout the southern South China sea  and especially the Java Sea.
zh: 我乘上这艘船 我们一路做调查 沿着中国南海 尤其是爪哇海

en: We transform the world,  but we don't remember it.
zh: 我们改变了世界 但却不认账

en: And the question is,  why do people accept this?
zh: 问题是 人们为什么对此安之若素呢

en: For example,  the anecdote that some present,  as Captain so-and-so  observed lots of fish in this area  cannot be used  or is usually not utilized by fishery scientists,  because it's not "scientific."
zh: 举个例子 有人讲了一个故事 说某某船长 发现这个地区有很多鱼 这个故事不能拿来当证据 渔业科学家通常也不会采纳这个故事 因为它不够“科学”

en: There I think  that the arts and film  can perhaps fill the gap,  and simulation.
zh: 我想 艺术作品和电影 可以填补这个空缺 还有原态模拟

en: This is a simulation of Chesapeake Bay.
zh: 这是切萨皮克湾的原态模拟

en: And so my recommendation,  it's the only one I will provide,  is for Cameron to do "Avatar II" underwater.
zh: 我建议 这也是我唯一的建议 希望卡梅隆的“阿凡达2”能在水下拍摄

en: Hi. I'm Kevin Allocca, I'm the trends manager at YouTube,  and I professionally watch YouTube videos.
zh: 你好。 我是凯文·阿劳卡。 我是YouTube的趋势分析经理， 而我的专业就是观看YouTube视频。

en: And of that, only a tiny percentage  ever goes viral and gets tons of views and becomes a cultural moment.
zh: 在众多中， 仅有极小比率 会风靡及得到万人收看率，并成为一种霎时文化。

en: Three things:  tastemakers, communities of participation  and unexpectedness.
zh: 三要素： 时髦开创者，社区参与 还有意想不到。

en: In 2010, it was viewed 23 million times.
zh: 在2010年，这部视频被观看了两千三百万次。

en: But he didn't actually set out to make a viral video, Bear.
zh: 不过熊先生并没有要拍风靡视频的意向。

en: Because that's what you do when your name is Yosemite Mountain Bear.
zh: 因为这正是自称“优胜美地山熊”的人会做的事。

en: Jimmy Kimmel actually.
zh: 就是吉米·吉梅尔。

en: Jimmy Kimmel posted this tweet  that would eventually propel the video to be as popular as it would become.
zh: 吉米·吉梅尔一则推文 推波助澜让这个视频大受欢迎。

en: Because tastemakers like Jimmy Kimmel  introduce us to new and interesting things  and bring them to a larger audience.
zh: 因为有像吉米·吉梅尔这种潮流先锋 为我们介绍新颖又有趣的事物 从而让观众接触到这些事物。

en: Rebecca Black: ♫ It's Friday, Friday. Gotta get down on Friday. ♫  ♫ Everybody's looking forward to the weekend, weekend. ♫  ♫ Friday, Friday. Gettin' down on Friday. ♫  KA: So you didn't think that we could actually have this conversation  without talking about this video I hope.
zh: 丽贝卡·布莱克：♫今天是周五，周五。玩乐派对在周五。♫ ♫每个人都期待着过周末，周末。♫ ♫周五，周五。玩乐在周五。♫ 凯文：如果没有这部视频，你未必能想到 我们将有接下来这场谈论。

en: Rebecca Black's "Friday" is one of the most popular videos of the year.
zh: 丽贝卡·布莱克的“周五”是年度最红的视频之一。

en: And similar to "Double Rainbow,"  it seems to have just sprouted up out of nowhere.
zh: 跟熊先生的“两道彩虹”雷同， 这部视频好像不知从哪儿就猛然窜红。

en: Well Tosh.0 picked it up, a lot of blogs starting writing about.
zh: 就是Tosh.0选中了它，很多部落格也争相讨论。

en: Michael J. Nelson from Mystery Science Theater  was one of the first people to post a joke about the video on Twitter.
zh: 奥秘科学剧院（电视节目)的迈克尔·约翰·纳尔逊 率先在他的推特上嘲弄这部视频。

en: But what's important is that an individual or a group of tastemakers  took a point of view  and they shared that with a larger audience, accelerating the process.
zh: 重点有这样一个或一群潮流先锋 看了视频后 跟广大观众分享他们的观点，加速整个视频窜红。

en: And now there are 10,000 parodies of "Friday" on YouTube.
zh: 所以现在有上万个恶搞版"周五”在YouTube上传播。

en: So "Nyan Cat" is a looped animation  with looped music.
zh: 这只“Nyan Cat" 是一种连环动画片 配合连续的背景音乐。

en: Someone made an old timey version.
zh: 有人还制作了怀旧版。

en: And then it went international.
zh: 然后走国际版路线。

en: An entire remix community sprouted up  that brought it from being just a stupid joke  to something that we can all actually be a part of.
zh: 整个混音群窜红 让这个原本只是个愚弄笑话 变成大家都可以参与创作的玩意。

en: Who could have predicted "Double Rainbow" or Rebecca Black  or "Nyan Cat?"
zh: 谁能料到“两道彩虹”或丽贝卡·布莱克 又或者“Nyan Cat” (喵喵喵）会红呢？

en: In a world where over two days of video  get uploaded every minute,  only that which is truly unique and unexpected  can stand out in the way that these things have.
zh: 在这个每分钟就上传足够两天 观看的网络视频世界， 只有那些独特和难以想象的视频 才能引人关注。

en: Casey Niestat: So I got a ticket for not riding in the bike lane,  but often there are obstructions  that keep you from properly riding in the bike lane.
zh: 凯西·尼塞特：我吃了一张罚单，因为我没在自行车道上骑车， 不过常常因为许多障碍 让你根本没法在自行车道上好好骑车。

en: KA: By being totally surprising and humorous,  Casey Niestat got his funny idea and point  seen five million times.
zh: 凯文：以出人意料的幽默方式 凯西·尼塞特有他有趣的想法和论点 吸引了五百万人次观看。

en: Tastemakers, creative participating communities,  complete unexpectedness,  these are characteristics of a new kind of media and a new kind of culture  where anyone has access  and the audience defines the popularity.
zh: 潮流先锋，创意参与团体， 以及怪咖， 这些是新媒体和新文化的特征 在其中人人能参与 让观众定义何为流行。

en: I mean, as mentioned earlier,  one of the biggest stars in the world right now, Justin Bieber,  got his start on YouTube.
zh: 正如我上述， 现在最红的艺人贾斯汀·比伯， 也是从YouTube上窜红。

en: No one has to green-light your idea.
zh: 你的点子不需要人允准。

en: How can I speak in 10 minutes  about the bonds of women over three generations,  about how the astonishing strength of those bonds  took hold in the life  of a four-year-old girl  huddled with her young sister,  her mother and her grandmother  for five days and nights  in a small boat in the China Sea  more than 30 years ago,  bonds that took hold in the life of that small girl
zh: 10分钟何尝够我来讲述， 关于三代妇女间的纽带， 关于这条纽带的惊人的力量 把 4岁小姑娘和 她的妹妹 母亲、祖母绑在一起， 5天5夜 挤在一条小船飘在中国海 已经过去了30多年， 一直留在小女孩的脑海中

en: Imagine the first piece:  a man burning his life's work.
zh: 回想起来的第一个画面是 一个男人拼尽全力地工作。

en: He is a poet, a playwright,  a man whose whole life  had been balanced on the single hope  of his country's unity and freedom.
zh: 他是一个诗人兼剧作家 一生 都致力于 国家的统一和自由。

en: Imagine him as the communists enter Saigon,  confronting the fact  that his life had been a complete waste.
zh: 想象着他作为一名共产主义者进入胡志明市 面对着 完全被抛弃的一生

en: My grandmother never let me forget his life.
zh: 祖父让我永记他的一生。

en: The next piece of the jigsaw  is of a boat in the early dawn  slipping silently out to sea.
zh: 下一块拼图是 黎明的早上一叶扁舟 悄悄滑向大海

en: My mother, Mai, was 18  when her father died --  already in an arranged marriage,  already with two small girls.
zh: 我母亲，Mai，18岁 丧父 经历了一系列婚姻， 有了两个小女儿。

en: So after a four-year saga that defies fiction,  a boat slipped out to sea  disguised as a fishing vessel.
zh: 因此，4年的蔑视小说的长篇故事 一条小船滑向大海， 远离渔船。

en: If we were captured, first my sister and I,  then she and my grandmother would drink.
zh: 如果我们被抓获，我妹妹、我、 母亲和祖母依次服毒自尽。

en: My first memories are from the boat --  the steady beat of the engine,  the bow dipping into each wave,  the vast and empty horizon.
zh: 我的第一个记忆来自于小船-- 发动机均匀的节奏 浅浅的波浪 一望无尽的海平面

en: We settled in Footscray,  a working-class suburb  whose demographic is layers of immigrants.
zh: 定居于Footscray， 一个的工薪阶层市郊, 以移民为主.

en: Unlike the settled middle-class suburbs,  whose existence I was oblivious of,  there was no sense of entitlement in Footscray.
zh: 不像定居其他中级阶层市郊， 我忘记了我的存在， 更别说权利了。

en: And the snippets of halting English  were exchanged between people  who had one thing in common,  they were starting again.
zh: 说着同样磕磕绊绊的英语， 人们相互交流着。 有一件事情是相同的， 又重新开始了。

en: My mother worked on farms,  then on a car assembly line,  working six days, double shifts.
zh: 母亲一开始在农村干活， 后来去了汽车组装线， 一周工作6天，双班倒。

en: And there were rare but searing chants  of "slit-eye"  and the occasional graffiti:  "Asian, go home."
zh: 虽然很少，但是搜寻圣歌的 边边角角， 偶尔的涂鸦说 “亚洲人，回家去吧！”

en: She opened a computer store  then studied to be a beautician  and opened another business.
zh: 她开了一家计算机商店， 学习美容， 将来开一家美容店。

en: And for that work, when I was a final year law student,  I was chosen as the young Australian of the year.
zh: 当我曾为法律系毕业生的时候， 我被选择作为当年的澳大利亚年轻代表。

en: Tan Le, anonymous Footscray resident,  was now Tan Le, refugee and social activist,  invited to speak in venues she had never heard of  and into homes whose existence  she could never have imagined.
zh: Tan Le一名Footscray普通居民， 现在是难民，社会积极分子， 被邀请演讲， 去一个从未听说过的 去一个无法想象是否存在的地方。

en: For a year we were penniless.
zh: 整整一年，我们一名不文。

en: She grew up at a time  when Confucianism was the social norm  and the local Mandarin was the person who mattered.
zh: 她成长的时代 儒教盛行， 本地Mandarin最大。

en: At 17 she became the second wife  of a Mandarin whose mother beat her.
zh: 她17岁嫁给了一个Mandarin， 做二房，遭到婆婆的打骂。

en: With no support from her husband,  she caused a sensation by taking him to court  and prosecuting her own case,  and a far greater sensation when she won.
zh: 没有丈夫的支持， 带着丈夫去法院起诉自己， 从而轰动一时， 胜诉的她更是名声远扬。

en: I knew she had come to say goodbye.
zh: 我知道她是来说声再见。

en: A few days later,  we went to a Buddhist temple in Footscray  and sat around her casket.
zh: 几天后， 我们去Footscray的佛寺， 坐在她的棺材旁。

en: "Because you have been holding it since this morning," he said.
zh: “因为您从早上一直握到现在”，他说

en: If there is a sinew in our family,  it runs through the women.
zh: 如果说我们家族有动力， 那它一定来着于妇女们。

en: Trevor Neilson: And also, Tan's mother is here today  in the fourth or fifth row.
zh: 同时，Tan的目前今天也来到的现场， 就坐于第四、五排。

en: I was in the desert, under the starry skies  with the Sufi singer Mukhtiar Ali.
zh: 我在沙漠，在一个满是星光的天空下 和一名苏菲派的歌手木泰哈·阿里

en: And we were in conversation  about how nothing had changed  since the time of the ancient Indian epic "The Mahabharata."
zh: 我们的谈话是关于 没有任何事情被改变 自从古代印度史诗《摩呵婆罗多》的时候起

en: Back then,  when Arjuna, the great Indian warrior prince,  when he was thirsty, he'd take out a bow,  he'd shoot it into the ground and water would come out.
zh: 在那个时候， 当印度伟大的战王阿朱那， 当他渴了，他拔出一支箭， 射进地里水就会出来

en: When I was a little girl,  my grandfather gave me his little silver pocket watch.
zh: 当我还是一个小女孩， 我的爷爷给我他的小银怀表

en: So I'm actually just going to go in and launch Khoya,  an interactive app for the iPad.
zh: 所以我实际上要推出Khoya, 一个iPad互动程序

en: So it says, "Place your fingers  upon each light."
zh: 它说，“将您的手指 放在每一个灯上”

en: At various points, a little letter drops down to me --  and the iPad knows where you live because of GPS --  which is actually addressed to me.
zh: 在不同的页面，一小封信掉下来给我-- 因为GPS, iPad知道你住在哪里 标记给我的

en: And I don't mean wizards and dragons,  I mean the kind of childhood magic,  those ideas that we all harbored as children.
zh: 并不是指巫婆和神龙， 而是指孩子们的魔法， 那些我们孩童时候心存的想法

en: This idea of fireflies in a jar, for some reason,  was always really exciting to me.
zh: 不知道为什么，萤火虫在坛子里的想法 常常令我十分兴奋

en: And so over here,  each book and each world  becomes a little marble  that I drag in  to this magical device within the device.
zh: 所以在这里 每一本书都 变成一个小的大理石 我将它们用这个装置 托进这个魔法的装置里面

en: So we've all heard about fairies and we've all heard about nymphs,  but how many people outside of India  know about their Indian counterparts, the Apsaras?
zh: 我们都听说过仙女，听说过女神， 但是有多少在印度之外的人 知道关于她们的对应者，飞天？

en: And so you need to make the sound of wind and blow them away  and read the rest of the book.
zh: 所以你需要弄出风的声音将它们吹走 然后读书下面的部分

en: We're bringing our children and ourselves  closer to the natural world  and childhood love that we had  through the simple medium of a story.
zh: 我们把我们的孩子和我们自己 和自然世界拉得更近 和我们 通过一个简单的传媒故事 带来魔法和愉快，以及孩童时候的爱

en: And one of the things we did at Radboud University  is we appointed a chief listening officer.
zh: 我们在荷兰内梅亨大学做的一件事 就是委任了一名首席倾听官

en: Not in a very scientific way --  she puts up a little cup of coffee or cup of tea  and asks patients, family, relatives,  "What's up?
zh: 不是以一种很科学的方式－ 她倒杯咖啡或者茶 问问病人，家庭，亲戚 “近来好啊？

en: This is my WiFi scale. It's a very simple thing.
zh: 这是我的WiFi体重测量仪 是个很简单的玩意

en: And I put my challenge on 95 kg.
zh: 我把体重目标值定为95kg

en: And it's collected by my general practitioner as well,  so he can see what's my problem in weight,  not on the very moment  that I need cardiologic support or something like it,  but also looking backward.
zh: 同时我的全科医生也可以收到 然后他就能看看我的体重有什么问题 不是等到像心脏病发作 这样十万火急的时候才想到看体重 而是一路走来都会关注

en: So every morning  I hop on my WiFi scale  and before I'm in my car, people start talking to me,  "I think you need a light lunch today, Lucien."
zh: 所以每天早上 我用WiFi体重测量仪称重 在我上车之前 人们就开始跟我说话了 “我想你今天午饭还是就简吧，吕西安”

en: And this is the point where patients get into position  and can collect, not only their own control again,  be captain of their own ship,  but also can help us in health care  due to the challenges that we face,  like health care cost explosion,  doubled demand and things like that.
zh: 这就是关键之处，当患者各就各位 收集数据时，他们不仅能自我控制 亲自掌舵 还能帮助我们应付 医疗保健中面临的挑战 比如医疗费用剧增 或者需求成倍增加等等

en: We know perfectly where all the ATMs are  about the city of Maastricht.
zh: 我们知道马斯特里赫特市 所有ATM的位置

en: But where would be the nearest AED  to help this patient?
zh: 但是最近的能拯救患者的 自动体外除颤器在哪儿？

en: Nobody knew where the nearest life-saving AED  was to be obtained right now.
zh: 没人知道的能救命的自动体外除颤器 现在能找到了

en: So what we did, we crowdsourced The Netherlands.
zh: 我们将属于整个荷兰的任务派发给群众

en: We set up a website  and asked the crowd, "If you see an AED,  please submit it, tell us where it is,  tell us when it's open,"  since sometimes in office hours sometimes it's closed, of course.
zh: 我们建了一个网站 告诉人们，“如果你看到一个自动体外除颤器 就请在网上标出它的位置 并备注开放时间” 备注是因为它不一定24小时都开放

en: And over 10,000 AEDs already in The Netherlands  already have been submitted.
zh: 在荷兰已经有一万多个AED 被标注上了

en: We made an application for Layar, augmented reality,  to find these AEDs.
zh: 一个Layar的应用，扩增实境 来寻找AED

en: And whenever you are in a city like Maastricht and somebody collapses,  you can use your iPhone,  and within the next weeks also run your Microsoft cellphone,  to find the nearest AED  which can save lives.
zh: 如果你在马斯特里赫特市 看到有人倒下了 你可以用iPhone 几周之内微软手机也可以了 找到最近的AED 来拯救生命

en: And as of today,  we would like to introduce this, not only as AED4EU,  which is what the product is called,  but also AED4US.
zh: 今天 我想介绍的，不仅仅是AED4U 这是那个产品的名字 还有aed4.us

en: And [we're] asking all of our colleagues in the rest of the world,  colleague universities, to help us  to find and work and act like a hub  to crowd-source all these AEDs all around the world.
zh: 在这里我们也呼吁世界各地的同事 和大学来帮我们 让我们万众一心 一起将世界各地的AED标识出来

en: That whenever you're on holiday and somebody collapses,  might it be your own relative or someone just in front of you,  you can find this.
zh: 这样当你假日外出看见有人昏倒了 也许是你的亲人或者只是路人 你就能找到AED

en: The other thing we would like to ask  is of companies also all over the world  that will be able to help us validate these AEDs.
zh: 在这里我们还想呼吁 世界上的各个公司 能帮我们验证这些AED

en: These might be courier services  or cable guys for instance,  just to see whether the AED that's submitted  still is in place.
zh: 譬如，或许让快递员 或者电报员 去看看被标识的AED 是不是还在那个位置

en: But combined in a certain way,  they can create something that still looks three-dimensional,  like it could exist.
zh: 但若将这些物体用某种方式组合起来 就可以创造出视觉上依然是三维的物体 就好像它是会存在的

en: The third one is about making it impossible to distinguish  where the different images begin and end  by making it seamless.
zh: 第三个原则是要让人难以分辨 这些不同照片的衔接点 使衔接看起来天衣无缝

en: So by matching color, contrast and brightness  in the borders between the different images,  adding photographic defects  like depth of field,  desaturated colors and noise,  we erase the borders between the different images  and make it look like one single image,  despite the fact that one image  can contain hundreds of layers basically.
zh: 通过匹配不同照片边缘的 色彩，对比度以及亮度 再加入一下摄影瑕疵 比如视野的深度 去饱和的色彩和噪音 我们可以除去不同照片之间的边界 使其看起来就像是一张单一的照片 即使一张照片 可包含上百个图层

en: One might think that this is just an image of a landscape  and the lower part is what's manipulated.
zh: 有人可能认为这只是一张风景图 下面的部分是处理过的

en: This happens to be a slide of some analysis that we were doing  about the power of RISC microprocessors  versus the power of local area networks.
zh: 这个是我们做的 关于RISC精简指令集微处理器功率 与本地网路功率分析的幻灯片。

en: And the interesting thing about it  is that this slide,  like so many technology slides that we're used to,  is a sort of a straight line  on a semi-log curve.
zh: 有趣的是 这页幻灯片 就像很多我们所熟悉的幻灯片一样， 是半对数曲线图 上的一条直线。

en: If you could bring up the lights higher,  because I'm just going to use a piece of paper here.
zh: 请把灯开亮点， 因为我要用张纸。

en: Now why do we draw technology curves  in semi-log curves?
zh: 为什么我们要用对数曲线 描绘科技曲线呢？

en: Well the answer is, if I drew it on a normal curve  where, let's say, this is years,  this is time of some sort,  and this is whatever measure of the technology  that I'm trying to graph,  the graphs look sort of silly.
zh: 嗯，答案是，如果我用普通曲线画， 我们说，这是年份， 这是某个时间， 这是我准备画的 科技的某种测量值， 这图看起来有点傻。

en: Now if I graph, for instance,  some other technology, say transportation technology,  on a semi-log curve,  it would look very stupid, it would look like a flat line.
zh: 现在，如果我画，比如说， 另一种技术，像是交通运输， 在半对数曲线上， 它看起来很蠢，会像条很平的线。

en: Either it's going to turn into a sort of classical S-curve like this,  until something totally different comes along,  or maybe it's going to do this.
zh: 要么它会变成像这样典型的S曲线 直到完全不同的情况出现。 或是会变成这样。

en: So if you go back  about two and a half billion years,  the Earth was this big, sterile hunk of rock  with a lot of chemicals floating around on it.
zh: 所以如果你回溯个 大概25亿年， 地球这么大，贫瘠的大块石头 上面浮着些化学物质。

en: And I think that there's theories that are beginning to understand  about how it started with RNA,  but I'm going to tell a sort of simple story of it,  which is that, at that time,  there were little drops of oil floating around  with all kinds of different recipes of chemicals in them.
zh: 我想有些理论是从理解 生命怎样从核糖核酸演变开始， 但是我想讲一个生命的简单故事， 就是，在那个时候， 有一滴滴的油四处浮动， 里面有各种不同化学成分组合。

en: They learned to record the information  that was the recipe of the cell  onto a particular kind of chemical  called DNA.
zh: 它们学会把 细胞形成的秘诀 记录到一种特殊物质上， 叫做去氧核糖核酸。

en: So in other words, they worked out,  in this mindless sort of evolutionary way,  a form of writing that let them write down what they were,  so that that way of writing it down could get copied.
zh: 也就是说，它们想出了， 以这种随性的进化方式， 可以写下它们基因信息的记录方式， 以便这种记录方式能被复制。

en: And I've got here a little 100 micrograms of white powder,  which I try not to let the security people see at airports.
zh: 我这有100微克的白粉， 我尽力不让机场安检人员发现它们。

en: But this has in it --  what I did is I took this code --  the code has standard letters that we use for symbolizing it --  and I wrote my business card onto a piece of DNA  and amplified it 10 to the 22 times.
zh: 不过这里面有代码 我所做的是我拿着这代码 它里面有我们用来标记它的标准字母， 然后我把我的名片写到一条去氧核糖核酸上 再放大10到22倍。

en: So if anyone would like a hundred million copies of my business card,  I have plenty for everyone in the room,  and, in fact, everyone in the world,  and it's right here.
zh: 所以如果有人需要数百万份我的名片， 我有足够多份给在座每个人， 甚至是全世界每个人， 就在这。

en: Writing down the DNA was an interesting step.
zh: 记录去氧核糖核酸是有趣的一步。

en: I don't know if you know this,  but bacteria can actually exchange DNA.
zh: 我不知道你们是否知道这个， 细菌实际上就可以交换去氧核糖核酸。

en: Some bacteria figured out how to stay away from penicillin,  and it went around sort of creating its little DNA information  with other bacteria,  and now we have a lot of bacteria that are resistant to penicillin,  because bacteria communicate.
zh: 有些细菌知道怎么远离青霉素， 然后它创造它这点去氧核糖核酸资讯， 并在别的细菌中到处游走， 现在我们有很多对青霉素免疫的细菌了， 因为细菌会交流资讯。

en: Now the transition point happened  when these communities got so close  that, in fact, they got together  and decided to write down the whole recipe for the community  together on one string of DNA.
zh: 于是，转换点到了， 当这些族群很亲近时， 事实上，它们聚集到一起 并决定在一条去氧核糖核酸上 写下整个族群的成分谱。

en: So for example, the invention of language  was a tiny step in that direction.
zh: 比如说，语言的发明 就是这个方向上很小一步。

en: And it all connects us together  into something  that is much bigger  and much faster  and able to evolve  So now, evolution can take place  on a scale of microseconds.
zh: 这些都是把我们联系在一起， 变的 比我们之前 更大， 更快， 更有能力进化。 所以，现在进化可以发生在 微妙的时间跨度级上。

en: And you saw Ty's little evolutionary example  where he sort of did a little bit of evolution  on the Convolution program right before your eyes.
zh: 你们看过泰伊的那个进化的小例子 它好像就在你们眼前的卷积程式上 展现了一点进化了。

en: Now would you please run all of those random sequences of instructions,  run all of those programs,  and pick out the ones that came closest to doing what I wanted."
zh: 现在请你运行所有这些随机指令列， 运行所有程式， 并选出最接近我想要的。”

en: But one of them, by luck,  may put two numbers in the right order.
zh: 但是中间有一个，运气很好， 可能会把两个数按顺序排列。

en: Take two programs and they produce children  by exchanging their subroutines,  and the children inherit the traits of the subroutines of the two programs.
zh: 取两个程式 交换它们的副程式让它们产生子女， 这些子女继承了两个程式副程式的特征。

en: I was riding in a 747  with Marvin Minsky once,  and he pulls out this card and says, "Oh look. Look at this.
zh: 我曾经有一次 和马文·明斯基一起坐747， 他拿出一张卡，说，“看，看这。

en: And what we are is we're at a point in time  which is analogous to when single-celled organisms  were turning into multi-celled organisms.
zh: 我们正是在时间的某一点， 这一点类似于单细胞有机体 正转变成多细胞机体的时刻。

en: So lunch is coming along,  and I think I will stop at that point,  before I get selected out.
zh: 午饭时间快到了， 趁我还没被选走， 我想我就在这里结束。

en: And there's hundreds of them.
zh: 让人咋舌的统计数据。

en: It's called batting average.
zh: 叫做击球率。

en: So we talk about a 300, a batter who bats 300.
zh: 当我们说一名挥棒球员的击球率为三成的时候，

en: That means that ballplayer batted safely, hit safely  three times out of 10 at bats.
zh: 我们是指这位球员的打击非常稳定， 每十次种就会有三次安打。

en: That means hit the ball into the outfield,  it dropped, it didn't get caught,  and whoever tried to throw it to first base didn't get there in time  and the runner was safe.
zh: 安打意味着球会被击中并被打入外野， 而且并不会被立刻接杀， 球也不会在跑者成功上到一垒之前 被及时的传回。

en: Three times out of 10.
zh: 十次中有三次安打。

en: Do you know what they call a 300 hitter  in Major League Baseball?
zh: 各位知道棒球大联盟如何评论 这些击球率上了三成的球员吗？

en: Do you know what they call  a 400 baseball hitter?
zh: 各位知道他们又是如何称呼一位 击球率有着四成，

en: That's somebody who hit, by the way,  four times safely out of every 10.
zh: 也就是每十次打击 就会打出四个安打的球员吗。

en: Legendary --  as in Ted Williams legendary --  the last Major League Baseball player  to hit over 400 during a regular season.
zh: 是传奇 -- 像泰德. 威廉斯那样的传奇-- 他是棒球大联盟里最后一个在常规赛中 拥有超过四成击球率的球员。

en: Suppose you have appendicitis  and you're referred to a surgeon  who's batting 400 on appendectomies.
zh: 假设你得了阑尾炎， 然后你被推荐给了一位 在阑尾移除手术中有着四成“击球率”的外科医生。

en: Now suppose you live  in a certain part of a certain remote place  and you have a loved one  who has blockages in two coronary arteries  and your family doctor refers that loved one to a cardiologist  who's batting 200 on angioplasties.
zh: 又假设你住在 某一个较为偏远的地区， 而你所爱的人的 两条冠状动脉都被堵塞。 你的家庭医生将她推荐给了一位在血管成形手术上 有着两成“击球率”的心脏科医师。

en: And she's hitting a 257.
zh: 她的“击球率”达到了两成五。

en: What do you think a batting average  for a cardiac surgeon or a nurse practitioner  or an orthopedic surgeon,  an OBGYN, a paramedic  is supposed to be?
zh: 你们认为， 一位心脏外科医生，或一位职业护理师， 一位骨科外科医生 妇产科医生或急救人员的 “击球率” 应该是多少？

en: 1,000, very good.
zh: 十成？非常好。

en: Now truth of the matter is,  nobody knows in all of medicine  what a good surgeon  or physician or paramedic  is supposed to bat.
zh: 事实上， 医学界中没有人知道 一个好的外科医生， 医师或急救人员 应该有多少的 “击球率”。

en: In high school, a classmate once said  that Brian Goldman would study for a blood test.
zh: 在中学时，有个同学曾经说 布莱恩.高德曼会为了血液测验复习。

en: And I memorized everything.
zh: 我背下了所有东西。

en: I memorized in my anatomy class  the origins and exertions of every muscle,  every branch of every artery that came off the aorta,  differential diagnoses obscure and common.
zh: 我背下了解剖课中 提到的每一块肌肉的起端和伸展方式， 每一条从主动脉延伸出来的动脉的分支系统， 以及一切鲜为人知的或者常见的鉴别诊断。

en: I even knew the differential diagnosis  in how to classify renal tubular acidosis.
zh: 我甚至知道如何鉴别诊断 不同的肾小管性酸中毒症。

en: for a while,  until I met Mrs. Drucker.
zh: 而我在一段时间之内 的确没有犯错。 直到我遇到了 Drucker 女士。

en: I was a resident at a teaching hospital here in Toronto  when Mrs. Drucker was brought to the emergency department  of the hospital where I was working.
zh: Drucker 女士被带入多伦多的 一家教学医院的急诊室时， 我正作为一个实习医生在那里工作。

en: At the time I was assigned to the cardiology service  on a cardiology rotation.
zh: 当时我正因心脏科轮调 而被指派在心血管诊所。

en: And I saw Mrs. Drucker, and she was breathless.
zh: 当我见到Drucker女士的时候，她的气息已经很微弱。

en: And when I listened to her chest with a stethoscope,  I could hear crackly sounds on both sides  that told me that she was in congestive heart failure.
zh: 当我用听诊器聆听她的胸腔时， 两边都传来的爆裂的声音告诉我， 这是郁血性心脏衰竭。

en: This is a condition in which the heart fails,  and instead of being able to pump all the blood forward,  some of the blood backs up into the lung, the lungs fill up with blood,  and that's why you have shortness of breath.
zh: 这是由于心脏在衰竭后， 无法将所有的血液完全的输送出去， 而导致部分血液回流入肺脏。肺脏里充满了血液， 而造成呼吸短促。

en: I gave her medications that we call diuretics, water pills,  to get her to pee out the access fluid.
zh: 我还给了她一些利尿剂，俗称水丸， 帮助她将体内多余的水分排出。

en: In sending her home,  I disregarded a little voice deep down inside  that was trying to tell me,  "Goldman, not a good idea. Don't do this."
zh: 在让她回家时， 我忽视了我内心一个微小的声音。 这个声音试图告诉我： “高德曼，这样不好，不要这么做。”

en: In fact, so lacking in confidence was I  that I actually asked the nurse  who was looking after Mrs. Drucker,  "Do you think it's okay if she goes home?"
zh: 其实，当时的我是如此的没有自信， 以至于我甚至向照顾Drucker女士 的护士寻求了意见： “你觉得让她回家好么？”

en: And the nurse thought about it  and said very matter-of-factly, "Yeah, I think she'll do okay."
zh: 那位护士想了想， 然后就事论事的说：“嗯，我觉得没有问题。”

en: And at the end of the day, I packed up to leave the hospital  and walked to the parking lot  to take my car and drive home  when I did something that I don't usually do.
zh: 在工作结束后，我整理了下便离开了医院。 在我走向停车场 去取我的车的路程中， 我做了一件我平常不会做的事情。

en: And it was there that another nurse,  not the nurse who was looking after Mrs. Drucker before, but another nurse,  said three words to me  that are the three words  that most emergency physicians I know dread.
zh: 而就在那里，另外一位护士， 不是之前照顾Drucker女士的那位， 对我说了 绝大部分急诊医生 都害怕听到的三个字。

en: Others in medicine dread them as well,  but there's something particular about emergency medicine  because we see patients so fleetingly.
zh: 其他科系的医生也害怕这三个字， 但因为急诊医生看的病人都来去匆匆， 这三个字对我们有着特别的意义。

en: the other nurse asked matter-of-factly.
zh: 那位护士就事论事的问道。

en: And at about the nine day mark, they let her go --  Mrs. Drucker,  a wife, a mother  and a grandmother.
zh: 在第九天，他们选择让她离开人间 -- Drucker女士， 一个家庭的妻子，母亲， 和祖母。

en: Over the next few weeks,  I beat myself up  and I experienced for the first time  the unhealthy shame that exists  in our culture of medicine --  where I felt alone, isolated,  not feeling the healthy kind of shame that you feel,  because you can't talk about it with your colleagues.
zh: 在接下来的几个星期内， 我无比的沮丧， 并第一次经历了 那种在医学文化中存在的 危险的羞愧感 -- 我觉得孤单无助。 这不是那种健康的羞愧感， 因为你不能和你的同事提起讨论它。

en: You know that healthy kind,  when you betray a secret that a best friend made you promise never to reveal  and then you get busted  and then your best friend confronts you  and you have terrible discussions,  but at the end of it all that sick feeling guides you  and you say, I'll never make that mistake again.
zh: – 就是那种， 当你背叛了对挚友的承诺而说出了答应要保守的秘密， 并被他知道了以后， 你的挚友找你算账时， 虽然你们会争执不休， 但最后那层罪恶感仍然会主导你， 你告诉自己，我绝对不会再犯同样的错误。

en: The unhealthy shame I'm talking about  is the one that makes you so sick inside.
zh: 而我所说的那种非良性的羞愧 会让你愧对于心。

en: He talked to the family, and I'm quite sure that he smoothed things over  and made sure that I didn't get sued.
zh: 他和那家人好好的谈过。我确定他为了确保 我没有被控告而替我打了圆场。

en: And on a cloudy day,  there was a crack in the clouds and the sun started to come out  and I wondered,  maybe I could feel better again.
zh: 然后在一个阴云密布的日子里， 当我看到一束阳光从云隙中探出， 我觉得， 或许我能再次感觉好起来。

en: And I made myself a bargain  that if only I redouble my efforts to be perfect  and never make another mistake again,  please make the voices stop.
zh: 然后我和自己做了一个约定： 如果我加倍努力做到完美， 不再犯错， 请就此让那自责的声音消去。

en: Well it turns out, he didn't have a strep throat.
zh: 原来，他并没有得链球菌性咽喉炎。

en: He had a potentially life-threatening condition  called epiglottitis.
zh: 得的是一种有可能威胁到生命的病症， 叫会厌炎。

en: One I thought had a kidney stone.
zh: 其中一位我诊断他有肾结石，

en: I ordered a kidney X-ray. When it turned out to be normal,  my colleague who was doing a reassessment of the patient  noticed some tenderness in the right lower quadrant and called the surgeons.
zh: 并安排了肾脏X光，但结果正常。 我的同事当时正在对病人的病情做重新的诊断。 在他留意到病人右下腹的地方有些柔软时，便联系了外科医生。

en: And in fact, if I knew and my colleagues knew  that one of my orthopedic colleagues took off the wrong leg in my hospital,  believe me, I'd have trouble  making eye contact with that person.
zh: 事实上，如果我，或者我的同事， 知道医院中一位骨科的同事帮病人截错了腿， 相信我，当我遇到他时， 我也无法与他有正常眼神的交汇。

en: In my 20 years or so  of medical broadcasting and journalism,  I've made a personal study of medical malpractice and medical errors  to learn everything I can,  from one of the first articles I wrote for the Toronto Star  to my show "White Coat, Black Art."
zh: 在我二十余年的 医疗广播和新闻工作中， 从我为多伦多星报所写的第一篇文章 到我的节目《白袍魔艺》， 我自行研究了我可以接触到的 一切医疗疏失和医疗错误。

en: We work in a system  where errors happen every day,  where one in 10 medications  are either the wrong medication given in hospital  or at the wrong dosage,  where hospital-acquired infections are getting more and more numerous,  causing havoc and death.
zh: 我们工作在一个 每天都会发生错误的制度中。 医院有十分之一的几率 会给错药 或者给了错误的剂量， 而在医院内被传染的病例正在日渐增多， 造成不必要的伤害和死亡。

en: In this country,  as many as 24,000 Canadians die  of preventable medical errors.
zh: 在这个国家中， 有将近2万4千多加拿大人死于 可以避免的医疗错误。

en: Now take the same patient with chest pain,  make them moist and garrulous  and put a little bit of alcohol on their breath,  and suddenly my history is laced with contempt.
zh: 但如果这位同样的胸痛的病人 当时胡言乱语 再加上呼吸带着些许的酒精味的话， 我写下的病历便会挟带着些许的轻蔑。

en: On my show, on "White Coat, Black Art,"  I made it a habit of saying, "Here's my worst mistake,"  I would say to everybody  from paramedics to the chief of cardiac surgery,  "Here's my worst mistake," blah, blah, blah, blah, blah,  "What about yours?" and I would point the microphone towards them.
zh: 在我的节目《白袍魔艺》中， 我已经会习惯性地说：“这是我最糟糕的错误”。 我会对从急救医士 到心脏外科首席医师的每个人这么说： “这是我最糟糕的错误，如是，如是。” 然后我会把麦克风递给他们，问：“你呢？”

en: And their pupils would dilate,  they would recoil,  then they would look down and swallow hard  and start to tell me their stories.
zh: 此时他们的瞳孔会放大， 他们会退却。 然后他们会看着地上，猛吞着口水 并开始向我倾诉他们的故事。

en: My name is Brian Goldman.
zh: 我是布莱恩.高德曼，

en: It was a store called Draeger's.
zh: 它的名字是Draeger‘s。

en: They had 250 different kinds of mustards and vinegars  and over 500 different kinds  of fruits and vegetables  and more than two dozen different kinds of bottled water --  and this was during a time when we actually used to drink tap water.
zh: 他们有250种不同的黄芥末和醋 还有超过500中不同种类的 蔬菜和水果 还有超过24中不同的瓶装水 而那是我们还在喝水龙头里的水的年代。

en: Here's their olive oil aisle.
zh: 这是卖橄榄油的过道。

en: Here's their jam aisle.
zh: 这是卖果酱的走廊。

en: We set up a little tasting booth  right near the entrance of the store.
zh: 在店门口的地方 我们摆设了一个小的品尝台。

en: The next thing we looked at  is in which case were people more likely  to buy a jar of jam.
zh: 我们观察的另一件事是： 在人们在哪种情况下更愿意 买一罐果酱

en: Now if you do the math,  people were at least six times more likely to buy a jar of jam  Now choosing not to buy a jar of jam  is probably good for us --  at least it's good for our waistlines --  but it turns out that this choice overload problem affects us  even in very consequential decisions. We choose not to choose,  even when it goes against our best self-interests.
zh: 现在如果你算一下的话， 当人们只有六种选择时， 比有24种时 买果酱的倾向上升了至少六倍 选择不买果酱 也许对我们来说是一件好事儿 至少对我们的水桶腰来说， 但是结果证明过度选择甚至在 非常重要的决定上影响我们。 我们甚至在有悖个人利益的情况下， 宁愿放弃选择。

en: Now I'm going to describe to you a study I did with Gur Huberman, Emir Kamenica, Wei Jang  where we looked at the retirement savings decisions  of nearly a million Americans  from about 650 plans  all in the U.S.
zh: 现在我要向你们介绍我与Gur Huberman, Emir Kamerica, Wei Jang 一起做的一个关于 近百万美国人在全美650多种 养老金计划中 选择的

en: And what we looked at  was whether the number of fund offerings  available in a retirement savings plan,  the 401 plan,  does that affect people's likelihood  to save more for tomorrow.
zh: 研究。 我们研究了 养老金计划， 也就是401（k)雇员福利中 所提供的基金选择数量， 是否影响人们 为未来存款的几率。

en: So in these plans, we had about 657 plans  that ranged from offering people  anywhere from two to 59 different fund offerings.
zh: 于是在这些计划中，我们选择了657个 从提供2到59种基金 的不同计划。

en: And what we found was that,  the more funds offered,  indeed, there was less participation rate.
zh: 我们发现， 事实上，提供的基金越多， 参购率就越低。

en: So if you look at the extremes,  those plans that offered you two funds,  participation rates were around in the mid-70s --  still not as high as we want it to be.
zh: 所以如果观察一下极端的情况的话， 会发现那些提供给客户两种基金的计划 的参购率在70左右， 仍然没有我们期待中的那么高。

en: In those plans that offered nearly 60 funds,  participation rates have now dropped  to about the 60th percentile.
zh: 那些提供接近60种基金的计划， 参购率降低到了 60多的参购率。

en: The main reason for this  is because, we might enjoy gazing at those giant walls  of mayonnaises, mustards, vinegars, jams,  but we can't actually do the math of comparing and contrasting  and actually picking from that stunning display.
zh: 这是因为， 虽然我们很享受看一排一排 由美乃滋，黄芥末，醋和果酱建成的的高墙， 却不愿意亲自比较 然后在如此庞大的陈列中做出选择。

en: The first: Cut.
zh: 一：精减。

en: People are always upset when I say, "Cut."
zh: 每一次我说“精减"的时候，人们总是会很生气。

en: When Proctor & Gamble  went from 26 different kinds of Head & Shoulders to 15,  they saw an increase in sales by 10 percent.
zh: 当保洁公司 将26种不同的海飞丝减至15种时， 销售额上升了百分之十。

en: When the Golden Cat Corporation  got rid of their 10 worst-selling cat litter products,  they saw an increase in profits  by 87 percent --  a function of both increase in sales  and lowering of costs.
zh: 当金猫公司 停止了他们的十种销售量最差的猫粮的销售， 盈利上升了 百分之八十七- 是又能增加销售额 还降低了成本两全其美的好方法。

en: But the ninth largest retailer,  the ninth biggest retailer in the world today  is Aldi,  and it offers you only 1,400 products --  one kind of canned tomato sauce.
zh: 但是，第九大的零售商 今天世界上第九大的零售商， 是阿尔迪， 而他们只提供给顾客1400种商品- 一种罐装番茄酱。

en: Now in the financial savings world,  I think one of the best examples that has recently come out  on how to best manage the choice offerings  has actually been something that David Laibson was heavily involved in designing,  which was the program that they have at Harvard.
zh: 在这个理财的世界中， 我认为在关于如何最有效地管理选择中 最好的例子是 David Laibson十分投入的 一个哈佛的项目。

en: So a study that I did with Shlomo Benartzi  and Alessandro Previtero,  we did a study with people at ING --  employees that are all working at ING --  and now these people were all in a session  where they're doing enrollment for their 401 plan.
zh: 所以在一个我与Shlomo Benartzi 和Alessandro Precitero做的研究中， 我们和所有ING的 员工一起做了一个研究， 所有人都参加了一个 一起注册401雇员福利的会议。

en: The one little thing we added  was we asked people  to just think about all the positive things that would happen in your life  By doing that simple thing,  there was an increase in enrollment by 20 percent  and there was an increase in the amount of people willing to save  or the amount that they were willing to put down into their savings account  by four percent.
zh: 我们加的是， 让他们 每个人都想象如果多存一些 生命中可能会发生的那些美好的事情。 仅仅是这样做后， 参与率上升了百分之二十， 人们愿意存钱的数额或者说是 愿意放进自己储蓄账户的金额增长了 百分之四。

en: It turns out that in Wegmans grocery stores  up and down the northeast corridor,  the magazine aisles range anywhere  from 331 different kinds of magazines  all the way up to 664.
zh: 发现在Wegmans百货商店中， 在东北走廊的地方， 买杂志的那一栏 有331到 甚至664种杂志。

en: The categories need to say something  to the chooser, not the choice-maker.
zh: 类别必须可以告诉 选择者一些事情，而不是创造选择的人。

en: My fourth technique: Condition for complexity.
zh: 我的第四个技巧是：从简入繁

en: It turns out we can actually  handle a lot more information than we think we can,  we've just got to take it a little easier.
zh: 事实上，我们所能 承受的信息量比我们想象的要高， 我们需要做的就是用轻松地面度对待。

en: Car colors, exterior car colors --  I've got 56 choices.
zh: 光车的颜色，内置的颜色 就有56种选择。

en: Engines, gearshift -- four choices.
zh: 有四种发动机，变速排档选择。

en: So now what I'm going to do  is I'm going to vary the order in which these decisions appear.
zh: 现在我要做的是 改变这些要做的决定出线的顺序。

en: So half of the customers  are going to go from high choice, 56 car colors,  to low choice, four gearshifts.
zh: 所以，一般的观众 要从选择多的决定开始-56种颜色 开始到选择少的决定-四种变速排档。

en: The other half of the customers  are going to go from low choice, four gearshifts,  to 56 car colors, high choice.
zh: 另外一半的观众 要从选择少的决定，四种变档开始 到56种车颜色，选择多的决定

en: If you keep hitting the default button per decision,  that means you're getting overwhelmed,  that means I'm losing you.
zh: 如果你不停地按默认选项的话 就说明你已经被选择淹没了， 也就是说我正在失去你的参与。

en: Even though choosing gearshift  doesn't tell me anything about my preferences for interior decor,  it still prepares me for how to choose.
zh: 即使选择变速排档 不能说明我对车内颜色的偏好 却仍能教会我如何去选择。

en: I have talked about four techniques  for mitigating the problem of choice overload --  cut -- get rid of the extraneous alternatives;  concretize -- make it real;  categorize -- we can handle more categories, less choices;  condition for complexity.
zh: 我讲了四种可以减缓过多选择的 技巧- 精简-放弃没有用的选择； 具体化-让选择变得更真实一些； 分类-我们能承受的类别比选择多； 从简入繁。

en: Like here, we have Mr. Dimitry Golubov  from the city of Kiev in Ukraine.
zh: 这里，我们有位德米特里 戈卢博夫先生 来自乌克兰的基辅市。

en: Here's Vladimir Tsastsin form Tartu in Estonia.
zh: 这里还有来自爱沙尼亚的塔尔图的弗拉基米尔·莎斯森。

en: This is Alfred Gonzalez.
zh: 这位是阿尔弗雷德·冈萨雷斯。

en: This is Stephen Watt.
zh: 这是斯蒂芬·瓦特

en: This is Bjorn Sundin.
zh: 这是比昂·松丁

en: This is Matthew Anderson, Tariq Al-Daour  and so on and so on.
zh: 这是马修·安德森，塔利克·阿尔杜 等等等等。

en: The U.S. Secret Service,  two months ago,  froze the Swiss bank account  of Mr. Sam Jain right here,  and that bank account had 14.9 million U.S. dollars on it  Mr. Jain himself is on the loose;  nobody knows where he is.
zh: 美国情报局， 两个月前， 冻结了萨姆 杰恩先生 在瑞士的银行账户， 那个账户冻结的时候 帐上有一千四百九十万美金。 杰恩先生本人仍逍遥法外； 没人知道他在哪。

en: So those are the three main attackers:  criminals who do it for the money,  hacktivists like Anonymous  doing it for the protest,  but then the last group are nation states,  governments doing the attacks.
zh: 这些就是三组主要的攻击者： 为了钱的罪犯， 匿名的攻击活跃者 为了抗议而作的， 而最后一组是民族国家， 政府在攻击。

en: And then we look at cases  like what happened in DigiNotar.
zh: 我们看一下例子 就像DigiNotar公司发生的。

en: DigiNotar is a Certificate Authority  from The Netherlands --  or actually, it was.
zh: DigiNotar是荷兰的 一个权威证书 或者说它曾经是。

en: And I asked last week  in a meeting with Dutch government representatives,  I asked one of the leaders of the team  whether he found plausible  that people died  because of the DigiNotar hack.
zh: 我上周 在与荷兰政府代表开会时问过， 我问一位领导 是否他发现有可能 有人会 因为Diginotar攻击而死亡。

en: Well DigiNotar is a C.A.
zh: DigiNotar是一个权威证书。

en: Well you need a certificate  if you have a website that has https,  SSL encrypted services,  services like Gmail.
zh: 你需要证书的情况会是 你有一个有https的网站， SSL加密服务， 类似Gmail的服务。

en: Now we all, or a big part of us,  use Gmail or one of their competitors,  but these services are especially popular  in totalitarian states  like Iran,  where dissidents  use foreign services like Gmail  because they know they are more trustworthy than the local services  and they are encrypted over SSL connections,  so the local government can't snoop  on their discussions.
zh: 当今我们所有人或大部分人， 使用Gmail或它对手们中的任何一家， 这些服务在极权主义国家 尤其流行 比如伊朗， 持异议者 使用诸如Gmail的国外服务 因为他们知道这些比当地的服务更可靠 他们通过SSL的连接加密， 所以当地政府窥探不到 他们的讨论。

en: and issue rogue certificates.
zh: 出具伪劣证书。

en: And this is exactly what happened  with the case of DigiNotar.
zh: 这恰恰就是发生在 DigiNotar的案子中。

en: Well in Egypt,  the rioters looted the headquarters  of the Egyptian secret police  in April 2011,  and when they were looting the building they found lots of papers.
zh: 在埃及， 暴徒们洗劫了 埃及秘密警察的总部 那是2011年4月， 他们洗劫时找到很多文件。

en: Among those papers,  was this binder entitled "FINFISHER."
zh: 在这些文件中， 有一个名叫FINFISHER的夹子。

en: For example, in Germany,  just a couple of weeks ago  the so-called State Trojan was found,  which was a trojan  used by German government officials  to investigate their own citizens.
zh: 比如，在德国， 就是几周前 发现一个叫Scuinst Trojan 的 木马病毒 被德国政府官方用来 调查他们自己的民众。

en: They will even use tools like State Trojan  to infect your computer with a trojan,  which enables them  to watch all your communication,  to listen to your online discussions,  to collect your passwords.
zh: 他们会用类似Scuinst Trojan的工具 用一个木马来感染你的电脑， 这样就让他们 监视你所有的通信， 监听你的在线讨论， 收集你的密码。

en: This is one of the cows which was killed at night,  and I just woke up in the morning and I found it dead,  and I felt so bad,  because it was the only bull we had.
zh: 这就是其中一只在夜晚被杀害的奶牛 我在早晨醒来时就发现它已经死了， 我的心情槽透了， 因为这是我家里唯一的公牛

en: The morans are the warriors  who protect our community and the livestock,  and they're also upset about this problem.
zh: 莫兰人都是勇士 他们保护我们的家族和牲畜 但是他们同样对这个问题感到沮丧，素手无策

en: And the first idea I got was to use fire,  because I thought lions were scared of fire.
zh: 我想到的第一个办法是使用火， 因为我知道狮子们都惧怕火。

en: I was trying to trick the lions  [into thinking] that I was standing near the cowshed.
zh: 我想要欺骗狮子 让它们误以为是我站在牛舍旁边。

en: So one night, I was walking around the cowshed with a torch,  and that day, the lions didn't come.
zh: 有一天晚上，我拿着手电筒在牛棚边走动， 那天晚上，狮子并没有来。

en: And I discovered that lions are afraid of a moving light.
zh: 我开始意识到狮子们会害怕移动的光。

en: And I got a switch where I can switch on the lights, on and off.
zh: 同时我找到了一个开关，可以控制灯的亮灭。

en: As you can see, the solar panel charges the battery,  and the battery supplies the power  to the small indicator box. I call it a transformer.
zh: 就如你所见，由太阳能接收板来给电池充电， 再由电池来指示器给提供能量 我把这个叫做“变压器”，

en: As you can see, the bulbs face outside,  because that's where the lions come from.
zh: 你可以看到，这个电灯泡是朝外的， 因为狮子是从那儿过来的。

en: The lights flash and trick  the lions into thinking I was walking around the cowshed,  but I was sleeping in my bed.
zh: 这个灯光一闪动就会使狮子受到欺骗 它们会以为是我在牛棚附近走动， 但实际上，此时的我正在自己的床上做着春秋大梦。

en: So I put the lights. You can see at the back, those are the lion lights.
zh: 我装上了这些灯，你们可以在背后看到，这些就是赶狮灯。

en: Since now, I've set up seven homes around my community,  and they're really working.
zh: 至今为止，我已为我们家族社区中的七户家庭装上了这个赶狮灯， 它们非常有用。

en: Because of this invention, I was lucky to get a scholarship  in one of the best schools in Kenya,  Brookhouse International School,  and I'm really excited about this.
zh: 我也很幸运地因为这项发明而获得了奖学金 这是肯尼亚最好的学校—— 布鲁克豪斯国际学校所颁发的， 我对此感到十分的兴奋。

en: I even took my friends back to my community,  and we're installing the lights to the homes  which don't have [any], and I'm teaching them how to put them.
zh: 我甚至将我的朋友带回我的社区， 帮助他们在没有赶狮灯的人家里安装这个 我教他们怎么安装。

en: So one year ago, I was just a boy in the savanna grassland  herding my father's cows,  and I used to see planes flying over,  and I told myself that one day, I'll be there inside.
zh: 一年前，我只是一个热带大草原上 帮爸爸放牛的普通男孩， 我常常看着飞机飞过， 并且告诉自己：总有一天，我也会在里面。

en: Ashê olên. It means in my language, thank you very much.
zh: 非常感谢（肯尼亚语）。在我的语言里，它的意思是：非常感谢！

en: So you got this scholarship.Richard Turere: Yep.
zh: 所以你已经拿到了这个奖学金。Richard Turere：是的。

en: CA: You already tried it once, right, and you --RT: I tried it before,  but I stopped because it gave me a shock.   CA: In the trenches. Richard Turere, you are something else.
zh: CA：你已经尝试过一次了，对吧，但是你——RT：我之前有过尝试， 但我停止了，因为它惊吓到我了。 CA：会是一场苦战。Richard Turere，你与众不同。

en: And I grew up singing a song called "Nothing To Envy."
zh: 我大一点后学会了一首叫做"无可羡慕"的歌，

en: This is the Amnok River,  which serves as a part of the border between North Korea and China.
zh: 这是鸭绿江， 作为着中国和朝鲜 边界的一部分。

en: As the Chinese officer approached my family,  I impulsively stood up, and I told him  that these are deaf and dumb people that I was chaperoning.
zh: 所以当那个中国警官快检查到我家人时， 我本能地站起来告诉他 这几位是聋哑人， 我是他们的监护人。

en: but I didn't have enough money to pay a bribe or fine anymore.
zh: 但是我已没有足够的钱 来贿赂或是交罚金了。

en: Many North Koreans are separated from their families,  and when they arrive in a new country,  they start with little or no money.
zh: 很多朝鲜人和他们的家人分离， 并且当他们来到新的国家时， 他们通常都只有很少的钱，或者身无分文。

en: This is South Central:  liquor stores,  fast food,  vacant lots.
zh: 这就是洛杉矶南区： 贩酒店， 快餐店， 闲置的土地。

en: This is South Los Angeles.   Liquor stores,  fast food,  vacant lots.
zh: 这是南洛杉矶 贩酒店， 快餐店， 闲置的土地。

en: Just like 26.5 million other Americans,  I live in a food desert,  South Central Los Angeles,  home of the drive-thru and the drive-by.
zh: 和其他两千六百五十万的美国人一样， 我生活在食物的荒漠， 洛杉矶南区， 是得来速（快餐商业模式，顾客不用下车即可获得服务）和飞车的家园。

en: I see wheelchairs bought and sold  like used cars.
zh: 我看到轮椅像二手汽车一样 进行买卖。

en: Thing is, it's owned by the city.
zh: 绿化带归政府所有。

en: The city came down on me,  and basically gave me a citation saying that I had to remove my garden,  which this citation was turning into a warrant.
zh: 政府指责我， 给了我张告票通知我必须移除我的花园， 之后告票变成了警告函。
